jobs.title: Sr Software Engineer
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Founded in 1965, Telecare is a rapidly growing mental health care company dedicated to making a difference for our clients, the community, and our employees. We offer an array of mental health services to adults with serious mental illness. We partner with public sector entities and behavioral health organizations and have over 155 programs and over 4,300 employees across the country. And we're growing all the time! When you work at Telecare, you help to empower thousands of individuals every day in their journeys of recovery. 

Telecare is proud to have been recognized by The Bay Area Business Times as the 9th Best Place To Work In the Bay Area for 2020! This is the 18th time we have made the list!

Our Corporate Headquarters has over 250 employees in the following departments:  Executive, Development, Finance, Information Systems, Human Resources, Operations, and Marketing & Operations.

Employment Status:  Full-Time

Partial remote work is an option.

Apply Here - https://recruiting2.ultipro.com/TEL1006/JobBoard/2fcbb6f4-e717-17cb-9327-3dd87a55b08d/OpportunityDetail?opportunityId=5412bf29-a8d3-4aad-b02c-fd32d7b5e888

POSITION SUMMARY

You will be an integral part of Telecare’s special projects IT team.  We are a fun, hardworking “swiss army knife” team that believes in modern development practices and team collaboration.  We aspire to build tools and integrate systems that are flexible, scalable, and make a direct difference in how our doctors, clinicians, and staff provide care and support to thousands of patients daily.

In this role, you will be responsible to build new tools and systems, integrate internal and external systems, enable & perform data analysis, data integration using a variety of tools, technologies, and frameworks, including Web Services/APIs, ASP.Net MVC, C#, .Net Core, jQuery, Angular, SQL Server, SQL SSIS, SAP BI, SAP Data Services, Qlik, Smartsheet, Microsoft O365 services, and other supporting technologies. 

QUALIFICATIONS
Required:
• B.S. in Computer Science, STEM-related degree or combination of equivalent experience
• Four (4) years professional software development experience in a modern programming language such as C#, Java or similar
• Four (4) years of database design and modeling experience
• Four (4) years of SQL/T-SQL experience - must be able to write and debug complex SQL queries
• Solid understanding & demonstrated proficiency in object-oriented (OO) analysis and design principles and patterns
• Knowledge and understanding of SDLC using Agile principles
• Familiar with common source-control tools & methodologies
• Highly detail-oriented with excellent analytical skills
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Ability to work well on a team as well as independently
• Must possess a highly positive and service-oriented approach to working both internally and externally
• Proven ability to troubleshoot and problem solve
• Strong understanding of technology with a natural inquisitiveness
• Must be at least 18 years of age
• All opportunities at Telecare are contingent upon successful completion and receipt of acceptable results of the applicable post-offer physical examination, 2-step PPD test for tuberculosis, acceptable criminal background clearances, excluded party sanctions, and degree or license verification. If the position requires driving, a valid driver's license, a motor vehicle clearance, and proof of auto insurance is required at the time of employment and must be maintained throughout employment. Additional regulatory, contractual, or local requirements may apply

Preferred:
• Experience working with REST APIs
• Experience with UI/UX design and development
• Experience with JavaScript libraries/frameworks such as jQuery, Angular, Node.js and React.
• Experience with cloud development or at least an understanding of the Azure Cloud platform and services.
• Experience with Reporting tools like Microsoft SSRS and Crystal Reports
• Experience with SharePoint (on-premise or Online)
• Experience with healthcare technology services, with emphasis on behavioral health, public health or other human service settings
• Experience with Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
• Demonstrate the Telecare mission, purpose, values, and beliefs in everyday language and contact with the internal and external stakeholders
• Design, develop, test, deploy, and maintain business applications built with a variety of technologies and frameworks
• Write well-documented, testable, and high-quality code
• Liaison with Business Analysts and customers to analyze business requirements
• Manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables
• Maintain a working knowledge of new uses for and new features of the applications and underlying technical components
• Ensures that problems or system issues are prioritized and addressed in a timely manner and status is communicated to affected users and IT Management
• Communicate clearly, insure instructions are clearly understood.
• Attends all team meetings
• Demonstrates a good rapport and cooperative working relationships with all members of the team; respond to co-workers expressing concerns and promote group morale
• Continually focuses on assigned tasks and seeks and implements improvements as necessary
• Demonstrates a knowledge of Telecare's customers including clients/residents, families and governmental agencies in all interactions and conduct
• Acts in a professional manner, always demonstrating respect and understanding of the community and fellow employees
• Completes and follows through with tasks and assignments, meeting expected deadlines
• Stays current with latest technical findings, new products, and software enhancements through trade journals, attendance at seminars and other means

Duties and responsibilities may be added, deleted and/or changed at the discretion of management.

SKILLS
• Exceptional interpersonal skills; able to effectively deal with diverse personalities
• Excellent oral and written ability
• Exceptional organizational skills and proven ability to manage projects and meet deadlines
• Strong analytical skills and demonstrated ability to translate loosely defined requirements into concrete report writing requirements

PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The physical demands here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, squat, twist, bend, reach, and carry items weighing 10 pounds or less as well as to frequently sit and do simple and power grasping. The position requires manual deviation, repetition and dexterity and to occasionally drive. Visual requirements include computers and books exposure.

EOE AA M/F/V Disability

Apply Here - https://recruiting2.ultipro.com/TEL1006/JobBoard/2fcbb6f4-e717-17cb-9327-3dd87a55b08d/OpportunityDetail?opportunityId=5412bf29-a8d3-4aad-b02c-fd32d7b5e888

jobs.title: Software Engineer | $71 - $82 per hour
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post



If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here:
https://www.hireart.com/jobs/b8d2b75c/apply


HireArt is helping the world’s largest social network hire a Software Engineer to join its infrastructure team. In this role, you will apply the principles of computer science and mathematical analysis to the design, development, testing, and evaluation of the software and systems that make computers work. You will also research, design, develop, and test operating-systems-level software, compilers, and network distribution programs for medical, industrial, military, communications, aerospace, business, scientific, and general-computing applications.

As a Software Engineer you will:

Review and approve the modification of existing databases and database management systems.
Instruct staff to write and code logical and physical database descriptions and specify identifiers of database to management system.
Direct database development and approve project scope and limitations.
Review project requests describing database user needs to estimate time and cost required to accomplish project.
Plan, coordinate, and implement security measures to safeguard information in computer files against accidental or unauthorized damage, modification or disclosure.
Approve, schedule, plan and supervise the installation and testing of new products and improvements to computer systems.
Develop standards/guidelines to guide the use and acquisition of software and protect vulnerable information.


If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here:
https://www.hireart.com/jobs/b8d2b75c/apply


Requirements

5+ years experience as a Software Engineer
 Python programming skills are a must
Experience in building WiFi and Bluetooth products
Experience with Linux Kernel drivers development (e.g. SDIO and PCIe)
Background in networking stack, performance, and memory optimizations
Android programming (i.e. Java, HAL/HIDL, and native [C/C++] services development)
Experience working with wpa_supplicant, hostapd, and libnl
Background in debugging complex, low level kernel driver and WiFi/Bluetooth firmware issues
Experience in wireless packet capture and analysis and  setting up wireless test automation and development

Commitment:This is a full-time, 3-month contract position staffed via HireArt and based in Menlo Park, CA. It will be fully remote until offices reopen and is available to candidates local to the Bay Area.
HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas or Corp to Corp hiring.

If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here:
https://www.hireart.com/jobs/b8d2b75c/apply

jobs.title: Research Software Engineer | $90 - $110 per hour
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post



If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here:
https://www.hireart.com/jobs/aeaeba4f/apply



HireArt is helping Toyota Research Institute (TRI) hire a Research Software Engineer, who is interested in the overlap between technology and the behavioral sciences, to architect systems for collecting and analyzing experimental data from human subjects.

The ideal candidate will have at least a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related Engineering disciplines and an interest supporting the collection and analysis of human subjects data. You'll also have experience with front/back end web development, mobile app development, and 
AWS.
As a Research Software Engineer, you will:
Develop systems to support human subjects data collection.
Work with researchers to determine requirements as well as to architect and test systems with research participants.
Iteratively develop mobile apps capable of collecting, archiving, and analyzing data from sensors as well as web-based survey applications.


If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here:
https://www.hireart.com/jobs/aeaeba4f/apply


Requirements
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (or equivalent work experience) in Computer Science or related Engineering disciplines, and interest supporting the collection and analysis of human subjects data.
Experience with front/back end web development (e.g., LAMP/MEAN/MERN platforms, reactive and responsive app design).
Extensive experience with mobile app development (e.g., iOS Swift/Obj-C, Android Java/Kotlin, cross platform development platforms).
Detail-oriented and able to work independently as well as in groups.
Enjoy collaborating with cross-disciplinary teams.
Proactive and seeks out new opportunities for impact, as time permits.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Comfortable giving and receiving feedback.
Strong time management and prioritization abilities.
A prototyping mindset - building solutions that are “good enough” to answer a steady stream of scientific questions.
Eager to learn new skills.

Nice-to-have Experience

AWS experience (e.g. launching EC2 instances, hosting data in AWS, etc.)

Experience with graphic design tools
Knowledge of basic app user testing methods
Knowledge of psychology or HCI research and interest in contributing to scientific publications

Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), on-going contract position staffed via HireArt and based in Los Altos, CA. This position will be fully remote until offices reopen. Candidates local to Los Altos are desired.HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas or employ corp-to-corp.

If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here:
https://www.hireart.com/jobs/aeaeba4f/apply


About Toyota Research Institute
At Toyota Research Institute (TRI), we’re working to build a future where everyone has the freedom to move, engage, and explore with a focus on reducing vehicle collisions, injuries, and fatalities. Join us in our mission to improve the quality of human life through advances in artificial intelligence, automated driving, robotics, and materials science. We’re dedicated to building a world of “mobility for all” where everyone, regardless of age or ability, can live in harmony with technology to enjoy a better life. Through innovations in AI, we’ll... ● Develop vehicles incapable of causing a crash, regardless of the actions of the driver. ● Develop technology for vehicles and robots to help people enjoy new levels of independence, access, and mobility. ● Bring advanced mobility technology to the market faster. ● Discover new materials that will make drive batteries and hydrogen fuel cells smaller, lighter, less expensive and more powerful. Our work is guided by a dedication to safety – in how we research, develop, and validate the performance of vehicle technology to benefit society. As a subsidiary of Toyota, TRI is fueled by a diverse and inclusive community of people who carry invaluable leadership, experience, and ideas from industry-leading companies. Over half of our technical team carries Ph.D. degrees. We’re continually searching for the world’s best talent ‒ people who are ready to define the new world of mobility with us! We strive to build a company that helps our people thrive, achieve work-life balance, and bring their best selves to work. At TRI, you will have the opportunity to enjoy the best of both worlds ‒ a fun start-up environment with brilliant people who enjoy solving tough problems and the financial backing to successfully achieve our goals. If you’re passionate about working with smart people to make cars safer, enable the elderly to age in place, or design alternative fuel sources, TRI is the place for you. ‒ Start your impossible with us. 

If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here:
https://www.hireart.com/jobs/aeaeba4f/apply

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Teacher Analytics
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by over 12 million students worldwide, is seeking Senior Software Engineers who have a passion for technology and education to help us add new features to our IXL Teacher Analytics reporting suite.

The IXL Teacher Analytics Engineering team is responsible for designing and creating the code that powers the analytics reports that thousands of teachers use to support the millions of students who use IXL. These reports are the ultimate tool that provide teachers with the critical data-driven insights that they need in order to help their students succeed. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions, and we are eager to have you join our team.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

Work closely with a team of talented full-stack engineers, both starting projects from scratch and also working within the existing code base
Build the back-end wiring, application logic, and UI for our products
Engage in every aspect of the development process, including designing, coding, documenting, testing, debugging, and performance tuning
Provide accurate estimates, evaluate feasibility, and assess new platforms and technologies for project implementations
Collaborate and communicate clearly across multiple development teams to design and release amazing products
Design code with scalability in mind as we continue to support an ever-growing number of users

TECHNOLOGY

The technologies that we use include Java, JavaScript, React, Redux, Sass, Highcharts, Git, PostgreSQL, Cassandra, Redis, and Kafka.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

4+ years of experience in software engineering
Bachelor's or advanced degree in Computer Science or a related discipline
Excellent programming skills in Java or other object-oriented language
Strong communication skills
Ability to collaborate well in a tight-knit small team
Willingness to take ownership and drive initiatives that you are passionate about
Strong analytical-reasoning and problem-solving skills
Knowledge of Java, SQL, JavaScript, and/or CSS is a plus
Passion for improving education through technology

ABOUT IXL LEARNING

IXL Learning is a leading educational technology company on a big mission: creating innovative learning experiences that help all learners reach their full potential. IXL's comprehensive curriculum and insightful analytics help more than 500,000 teachers deliver personalized instruction, and empower over 12 million students to achieve new learning milestones every day.

At IXL, we’re passionate about our mission of creating the best educational technology that improves learning for all students. We bring that same passion to creating a workplace that values diversity on the basis that all of us bring a unique perspective and experience that advances IXL’s mission.  

We strive to increase diversity in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, and physical or mental ability and to continually promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work.

Click here to apply

jobs.title: Software Engineer - New Grad (CA)
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 12 million students worldwide, is seeking new graduates who have a passion for technology and education. You will dive into our code base and immediately contribute to our three extremely impactful educational products and build new, innovative products. You can fine-tune your existing skills and learn new ones as you work on one of our many teams. You’ll be able to work with our Core Technology team in back-end engineering, Front-end group using cutting-edge technologies like React, Mobile team in implementing iOS and Android apps, or our Full-stack teams who seek engineers interested in doing it all.

We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions, and we are eager to have you join our team.

International candidates encouraged to apply; H1B sponsorship is available.

TECHNOLOGY

Our server-side stack currently includes Linux, Apache, Java, Scala, Python, and Oracle. For our iOS app development, we use Swift. Our front-end code is written in JavaScript (including the React and D3 libraries, and ES6). Of course, the specific technologies and languages you use will vary by project and according to your own interests or specialization areas.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

As a Software Engineer, you will build the back-end wiring, application logic, and UI that engage our users. You will find and use the best technologies to add features and create new products. You’ll be involved in all aspects of the development process – including design, coding, testing, debugging, and tuning. You will own your projects from start to end as they travel through our fast-paced development cycle. In addition to working with your fellow engineers, you’ll collaborate with other teams to design amazing products that meet the needs of our users, who are students and teachers all over the world.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

Bachelor's or advanced degree in computer science or a related discipline
Excellent programming skills
Strong analytical-reasoning and problem-solving skills
Ability to work both independently and with a wide variety of teams
Knowledge of Unix, Python, Java, SQL, JavaScript, or Mobile app development is a plus
Passion for improving education through technology

ABOUT IXL

IXL Learning is a leading educational technology company on a big mission: creating innovative learning experiences that help all learners reach their full potential. IXL's comprehensive curriculum and insightful analytics help more than 500,000 teachers deliver personalized instruction and empower over 12 million students to achieve new learning milestones every day.

At IXL, we’re passionate about our mission of creating the best educational technology that improves learning for all students. We bring that same passion to creating a workplace that values diversity on the basis that all of us bring a unique perspective and experience that advances IXL’s mission.

We strive to increase diversity in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, and physical or mental ability and to continually promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work.
Click here to apply

jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer.
jobs.location: SF bay area / San Francisco City Of San Francisco
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Span.IO, Inc. in San Francisco, CA seeks Principal Software Engineer. 

Responsibilities: The Principal Software Engineer is responsible for architecture, design, development, and support of software applications for backend and cloud systems. Performs technical analysis and research to enhance frameworks using Javascript (Node.js and React Native) and Python. Identifies Infrastructure, Platform, and Software as a Service vendors suited for Span.IO’s needs. Uses technical tools and strategies to design, test, lint, validate, and deploy system processes. Manages large batch data processing and visualization in real-time. Leads in the design and implementation of mobile and firmware applications for Span.IO. Works with Product and Design to establish roadmaps and timelines. Works with Engineers to ensure plans are timely executed. Serves as a mentor to junior engineers. Other duties as assigned.

Education: Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field (or foreign equivalent).

Requirements: 5 years of progressive, post-baccalaureate experience in the job offered or similar software engineering positions. Other special requirements: 5 years of experience designing data storage and transmission interfaces, such as APIs and database schemas; 5 years of experience working with backend software to develop a data product that displays insights; 3 years of experience using the following coding languages: JavaScript, Python, Scala, and PostgresSQL; 3 years of experience designing, implementing, and maintaining frameworks and systems; and 1 year of experience implementing cross platform mobile applications using React Native.

Qualified applicants must mail resume to Span.IO, Inc., Attn: Angela, 5235 48th Ave SW, Seattle, WA 98136 quoting job #PSE14.

If you’re passionate about working with smart people to make cars safer, enable the elderly to age in place, or design alternative fuel sources, TRI is the place for you. ‒ Start your impossible with us.

Zymergen Inc. seeks Senior Software Engineer in Emeryville, CA. 

Responsibilities: Responsible for developing specialized applications and providing subject-matter expertise on integration of new software into the Zymergen platform. Responsibilities include: designing, developing, and maintaining specialized integration platforms for Mulesoft and related software; analyzing business and technical requirements and translating requirements into development roadmaps; configuring Workday, Salesforce, Netsuite, and similar applications based on business needs; troubleshooting system errors and application issues including permissions and configurations; and monitoring performance to ensure smooth integration of various software features; tracking ongoing projects to ensure timely delivery; and other duties as assigned.

Education: Master’s* degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related technical field (or foreign equivalent).

Requirements: 2 years* of experience in the job offered or related positions. Other special requirements include: 2 years of experience working with Mulesoft, Dell Boomi, Informatica, or similar integration platform; 2 years of experience developing and customizing applications with SOAP or RESTFul APIs; 2 years of experience collaborating with non-technical teams on business and technical requirements; and 2 years of experience assisting business teams with software integration and troubleshooting.

*In lieu of a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical field (or foreign equivalent) and 2 years of experience in the job offered or related positions, employer will accept candidates with a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical field (or foreign equivalent) and 5 years of progressive, post-baccalaureate experience in the job offered or related positions.

Qualified applicants must fax resume to +1 510-225-2455 quoting job #SSE21.

jobs.title: Sr Software Engineer
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Founded in 1965, Telecare is a rapidly growing mental health care company dedicated to making a difference for our clients, the community, and our employees. We offer an array of mental health services to adults with serious mental illness. We partner with public sector entities and behavioral health organizations and have over 155 programs and over 4,300 employees across the country. And we're growing all the time! When you work at Telecare, you help to empower thousands of individuals every day in their journeys of recovery. 

Telecare is proud to have been recognized by The Bay Area Business Times as the 9th Best Place To Work In the Bay Area for 2020! This is the 18th time we have made the list!

Our Corporate Headquarters has over 250 employees in the following departments:  Executive, Development, Finance, Information Systems, Human Resources, Operations, and Marketing & Operations.

Employment Status:  Full-Time

Partial remote work is an option.

Apply Here - https://recruiting2.ultipro.com/TEL1006/JobBoard/2fcbb6f4-e717-17cb-9327-3dd87a55b08d/OpportunityDetail?opportunityId=5412bf29-a8d3-4aad-b02c-fd32d7b5e888

POSITION SUMMARY

You will be an integral part of Telecare’s special projects IT team.  We are a fun, hardworking “swiss army knife” team that believes in modern development practices and team collaboration.  We aspire to build tools and integrate systems that are flexible, scalable, and make a direct difference in how our doctors, clinicians, and staff provide care and support to thousands of patients daily.

In this role, you will be responsible to build new tools and systems, integrate internal and external systems, enable & perform data analysis, data integration using a variety of tools, technologies, and frameworks, including Web Services/APIs, ASP.Net MVC, C#, .Net Core, jQuery, Angular, SQL Server, SQL SSIS, SAP BI, SAP Data Services, Qlik, Smartsheet, Microsoft O365 services, and other supporting technologies. 

QUALIFICATIONS
Required:
• B.S. in Computer Science, STEM-related degree or combination of equivalent experience
• Four (4) years professional software development experience in a modern programming language such as C#, Java or similar
• Four (4) years of database design and modeling experience
• Four (4) years of SQL/T-SQL experience - must be able to write and debug complex SQL queries
• Solid understanding & demonstrated proficiency in object-oriented (OO) analysis and design principles and patterns
• Knowledge and understanding of SDLC using Agile principles
• Familiar with common source-control tools & methodologies
• Highly detail-oriented with excellent analytical skills
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Ability to work well on a team as well as independently
• Must possess a highly positive and service-oriented approach to working both internally and externally
• Proven ability to troubleshoot and problem solve
• Strong understanding of technology with a natural inquisitiveness
• Must be at least 18 years of age
• All opportunities at Telecare are contingent upon successful completion and receipt of acceptable results of the applicable post-offer physical examination, 2-step PPD test for tuberculosis, acceptable criminal background clearances, excluded party sanctions, and degree or license verification. If the position requires driving, a valid driver's license, a motor vehicle clearance, and proof of auto insurance is required at the time of employment and must be maintained throughout employment. Additional regulatory, contractual, or local requirements may apply

Preferred:
• Experience working with REST APIs
• Experience with UI/UX design and development
• Experience with JavaScript libraries/frameworks such as jQuery, Angular, Node.js and React.
• Experience with cloud development or at least an understanding of the Azure Cloud platform and services.
• Experience with Reporting tools like Microsoft SSRS and Crystal Reports
• Experience with SharePoint (on-premise or Online)
• Experience with healthcare technology services, with emphasis on behavioral health, public health or other human service settings
• Experience with Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
• Demonstrate the Telecare mission, purpose, values, and beliefs in everyday language and contact with the internal and external stakeholders
• Design, develop, test, deploy, and maintain business applications built with a variety of technologies and frameworks
• Write well-documented, testable, and high-quality code
• Liaison with Business Analysts and customers to analyze business requirements
• Manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables
• Maintain a working knowledge of new uses for and new features of the applications and underlying technical components
• Ensures that problems or system issues are prioritized and addressed in a timely manner and status is communicated to affected users and IT Management
• Communicate clearly, insure instructions are clearly understood.
• Attends all team meetings
• Demonstrates a good rapport and cooperative working relationships with all members of the team; respond to co-workers expressing concerns and promote group morale
• Continually focuses on assigned tasks and seeks and implements improvements as necessary
• Demonstrates a knowledge of Telecare's customers including clients/residents, families and governmental agencies in all interactions and conduct
• Acts in a professional manner, always demonstrating respect and understanding of the community and fellow employees
• Completes and follows through with tasks and assignments, meeting expected deadlines
• Stays current with latest technical findings, new products, and software enhancements through trade journals, attendance at seminars and other means

Duties and responsibilities may be added, deleted and/or changed at the discretion of management.

SKILLS
• Exceptional interpersonal skills; able to effectively deal with diverse personalities
• Excellent oral and written ability
• Exceptional organizational skills and proven ability to manage projects and meet deadlines
• Strong analytical skills and demonstrated ability to translate loosely defined requirements into concrete report writing requirements

PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The physical demands here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, squat, twist, bend, reach, and carry items weighing 10 pounds or less as well as to frequently sit and do simple and power grasping. The position requires manual deviation, repetition and dexterity and to occasionally drive. Visual requirements include computers and books exposure.

EOE AA M/F/V Disability

Apply Here - https://recruiting2.ultipro.com/TEL1006/JobBoard/2fcbb6f4-e717-17cb-9327-3dd87a55b08d/OpportunityDetail?opportunityId=5412bf29-a8d3-4aad-b02c-fd32d7b5e888

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 12 million students worldwide, is seeking Software Engineers who have a passion for technology and education to help us add new features to our three extremely successful educational products and build new, innovative products. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions, and we are eager to have you join our team.


WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

Work with a team of talented engineers, both starting projects from scratch and also working within the existing code base
Build the back-end wiring, application logic, and UI for our products
Drive the development process for your team, including design, coding, documenting, testing, debugging, and tuning
Provide accurate estimates, evaluate feasibility, and assess new platforms and technologies for project implementations
Collaborate and communicate clearly across multiple development teams to design and release amazing products


WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

2+ years of experience in software engineering
Bachelor's or advanced degree in Computer Science or a related discipline
Excellent programming skills in Java or other object-oriented language
Strong communication skills
Strong analytical-reasoning and problem-solving skills
Passion for improving education through technology

ABOUT IXL LEARNING

IXL Learning is a leading educational technology company on a big mission: creating innovative learning experiences that help all learners reach their full potential. IXL's comprehensive curriculum and insightful analytics help more than 500,000 teachers deliver personalized instruction and empower over 12 million students to achieve new learning milestones every day.

At IXL, we’re passionate about our mission of creating the best educational technology that improves learning for all students. We bring that same passion to creating a workplace that values diversity on the basis that all of us bring a unique perspective and experience that advances IXL’s mission.

We strive to increase diversity in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, and physical or mental ability and to continually promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work.
Click here to apply

About Toyota Research Institute
At Toyota Research Institute (TRI), we’re working to build a future where everyone has the freedom to move, engage, and explore with a focus on reducing vehicle collisions, injuries, and fatalities. Join us in our mission to improve the quality of human life through advances in artificial intelligence, automated driving, robotics, and materials science. We’re dedicated to building a world of “mobility for all” where everyone, regardless of age or ability, can live in harmony with technology to enjoy a better life. Through innovations in AI, we’ll... ● Develop vehicles incapable of causing a crash, regardless of the actions of the driver. ● Develop technology for vehicles and robots to help people enjoy new levels of independence, access, and mobility. ● Bring advanced mobility technology to the market faster. ● Discover new materials that will make drive batteries and hydrogen fuel cells smaller, lighter, less expensive and more powerful. Our work is guided by a dedication to safety – in how we research, develop, and validate the performance of vehicle technology to benefit society. As a subsidiary of Toyota, TRI is fueled by a diverse and inclusive community of people who carry invaluable leadership, experience, and ideas from industry-leading companies. Over half of our technical team carries Ph.D. degrees. We’re continually searching for the world’s best talent ‒ people who are ready to define the new world of mobility with us! We strive to build a company that helps our people thrive, achieve work-life balance, and bring their best selves to work. At TRI, you will have the opportunity to enjoy the best of both worlds ‒ a fun start-up environment with brilliant people who enjoy solving tough problems and the financial backing to successfully achieve our goals. If you’re passionate about working with smart people to make cars safer, enable the elderly to age in place, or design alternative fuel sources, TRI is the place for you. ‒ Start your impossible with us.

jobs.title: Stationary Building Engineer
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


The Building Engineer will work under the general direction of the Regional Engineering Manager and will work independently overseeing and performing the tasks of building facility work, repairs and preventative maintenance leveraging their experience in the building engineering field. All engineering Techs and Supervisors shall comply with all federal, state and the Employer’s safety policies and, directives. Engineering Techs and Supervisors shall, if and when called upon, shall perform any or all of the following skilled, technical and Tech duties but not necessarily limited to installing, maintaining, replacing, repairing, operating or assisting in operating all heating and ventilation equipment, engines, motors, combustion engines, pumps, air compressors, ice and refrigerating machines, air conditioning units, fans, also automatic and power-oiling pumps and engines, more specifically described as follows:
Position Responsibilities:
•	Issue work schedules for self, staff, and subcontractors.
•	Manage subcontractors and manage small projects.
•	Prepare and present performance reports on building and building systems including managing and reporting of KPI’s (Key Performance Indicators)
•	Receive and complete appropriate tasks as assigned by manager, director or other company leadership.
•	Participate in leadership meetings, trainings and conferences.

Technical Responsibilities:
•	Operation, maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of all boilers, heaters pumps, valves, and lines used in the distribution of heated or processed water.
•	Operation, maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of refrigerant compressors, condensers, evaporators, traps, transfer pumps, expansion valves, stop valves and float valves, together with all refrigerant lines and devices used to control temperature, and air conditioning systems in their entirety.
•	Operation, maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of air compressors, together with distribution lines and all valves and devices for air control.
•	Operation, maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of all natural and manufactured gas distribution lines, including all valves and devices for air control.
•	Operation, maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of water filters, softeners, piping and pumps used in conjunction with water distribution, including all sinks and toilet bowls, including all supply lines, drains, water lines, control devices and sprinkler systems.
•	Operation, maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of all types of electrical motors and engines used to power pumps, compressors and fans. 
•	All electrical work and repair.
•	Tools considered as necessary to the fulfillment of the duties of the engineer shall include all those which may be required in the performance of his duties, including such types of special equipment necessary to operate, install, maintain and repair the equipment listed.
•	Operation, maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of building automation systems for HVAC, including consoles, data gathering panels, remote sensors and indicating devices.
•	Operation, maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of sanitary sewer systems, sump pumps including basins, water closets, urinals and piping.
•	Maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of trash compactors, including electrical and hydraulic systems.
•	Prepare and monitor time reporting (weekly).
•	Assist Regional Engineering Manager with preparation and reporting for periodic business reviews (PBR).
•	Order materials when required.
•	Attend construction meetings and provide input to building management to ensure optimal operations of the building.
•	Maintain and issue building access card and keys.
•	Monitor and report on energy consumption.
•	Operate, schedule and report utilizing Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS)
•	Operation, maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of all life Safety related equipment.
•	Ad hoc projects and other job duties as assigned.

Position Requirements
To perform this job successfully, and individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.  The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 

•	Basic computer skills and word processing. 
•	Good mathematical background. 
•	Experience with spreadsheets and automated accounting systems. 
•	Ability to sort, check, count, and verify numbers.
•	Ability to multi-task, prioritize and work efficiently. 
•	Ability to listen, communicate (written and verbal), and follow-up effectively with all staffing levels and clients/customers. 
•	Excellent grammar, spelling and proof-reading skills. 
•	Ability to work independently, be a self-starter, and energetically approach tasks assigned.
•	Ability to demonstrate good common sense and sound judgment. 
•	Flexibility to adapt to all situations and work varied hours; possibly work weekends or evenings. 
•	Ability to perform at high levels in a fast-paced ever-changing work environment. 
•	Ability to anticipate work needs and follow through with minimum direction.
Education and/or Experience:  The preferred candidate will possess a college level certificate in a closely related field and have three to five years of experience in increasing operational responsibilities or have a minimum of 5 years hands-on experience in Building Engineering Operations.  Candidate must possess a strong working knowledge of building trades, procurement order to invoice processing and leadership responsibilities in an electronic driven environment.

Language Skills:  Ability to read and comprehend instructions, short correspondence and memos.   Ability to write simple correspondence.  Ability to effectively present information one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients and other employees of the organization.  English required, bilingual a plus. 

Reasoning Ability:  Able to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed written or oral instructions.  Ability to deal with problems involving several variables in standardized situations.  Strong analytical skills are a must. 

Computer Skills:  Experience with word processing, spreadsheets, Internet software, email and/or database software preferred.  Microsoft Office skills are required. 

Physical Demands:  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.   

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; use hands to manipulate, handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear.  The employee is frequently required to sit.  The employee is occasionally required to climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; and smell.  The employee is occasionally required to lift up to 20 pounds

-Bachelor in Civil Engineering, Architecture or Construction Management.
-Inspection credential certifications (concrete/ paving/ compaction/ rebar/ etc…)


Job Responsibilities:

Assisting the resident engineer and the construction manager in field inspection and monitoring construction quality, potential delays, time and material documentation, coordinating special inspection.

Provide detailed daily construction reports and photo documentation.

Reviewing the contractors pay estimate and approving the invoices.

Study drawings and insure the coordination between the designer and the existing utilities.

Please email your resume if interested.

jobs.title: Building Maintenance Engineer
jobs.location: SF bay area / Richmond / Point / Annex
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Position Summary
The Maintenance Engineering Tech will work under the general direction of the Regional Engineering Manager and will work independently overseeing and performing the tasks of building facility work, repairs and preventative maintenance leveraging their experience in the building engineering field. All engineering Techs shall comply with all federal, state and the Employer’s safety policies and, directives. Engineering Techs shall, if and when called upon, shall perform any or all of the following skilled, technical and Techy duties but not necessarily limited to installing, maintaining, replacing, repairing, operating or assisting in operating all heating and ventilation equipment, engines, motors, combustion engines, pumps, air compressors, ice and refrigerating machines, air conditioning units, fans, also automatic and power-oiling pumps and engines, more specifically described as follows:
Position Responsibilities:
•	Issue work schedules for self, staff, and subcontractors.
•	Manage subcontractors and manage small projects.
•	Responsible for hiring, managing and discipline of assigned staff.
•	Prepare and present performance reports on building and building systems 
•	Receive and complete appropriate tasks as assigned by manager, director or other company leadership.
•	Participate in leadership meetings, trainings and conferences.

Technical Responsibilities:
•	Operation, maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of all boilers, heaters pumps, valves, and lines used in the distribution of heated or processed water.
•	Operation, maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of refrigerant compressors, condensers, evaporators, traps, transfer pumps, expansion valves, stop valves and float valves, together with all refrigerant lines and devices used to control temperature, and air conditioning systems in their entirety.
•	Operation, maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of air compressors, together with distribution lines and all valves and devices for air control.
•	Operation, maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of all natural and manufactured gas distribution lines, including all valves and devices for air control.
•	Operation, maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of water filters, softeners, piping and pumps used in conjunction with water distribution, including all sinks and toilet bowls, including all supply lines, drains, water lines, control devices and sprinkler systems.
•	Operation, maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of all types of electrical motors and engines used to power pumps, compressors and fans. 
•	All electrical work and repair.
•	Tools considered as necessary to the fulfillment of the duties of the engineer shall include all those which may be required in the performance of his duties, including such types of special equipment necessary to operate, install, maintain and repair the equipment listed.
•	Operation, maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of building automation systems for HVAC, including consoles, data gathering panels, remote sensors and indicating devices.
•	Operation, maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of sanitary sewer systems, sump pumps including basins, water closets, urinals and piping.
•	Maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of trash compactors, including electrical and hydraulic systems.
•	Prepare and monitor time reporting (weekly).
•	Assist Regional Engineering Manager with preparation and reporting for periodic business reviews (PBR).
•	Order materials when required.
•	Attend construction meetings and provide input to building management to ensure optimal operations of the building.
•	Monitor and report on energy consumption.
•	Operate, schedule and report utilizing Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS)
•	Operation, maintenance, installation, replacement and repair of all life Safety related equipment.
•	

Position Requirements
To perform this job successfully, and individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.  The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 

•	Basic computer skills and word processing. 
•	Good mathematical background. 
•	Experience with spreadsheets and automated accounting systems. 
•	Ability to sort, check, count, and verify numbers.
•	Ability to multi-task, prioritize and work efficiently. 
•	Ability to listen, communicate (written and verbal), and follow-up effectively with all staffing levels and clients/customers. 
•	Excellent grammar, spelling and proof-reading skills. 
•	Ability to work independently, be a self-starter, and energetically approach tasks assigned.
•	Ability to demonstrate good common sense and sound judgment. 
•	Flexibility to adapt to all situations and work varied hours; possibly work weekends or evenings. 
•	Ability to perform at high levels in a fast-paced ever-changing work environment. 
•	Ability to anticipate work needs and follow through with minimum direction.
Education and/or Experience:  The preferred candidate will possess a technical certificate in a closely related field and have three to five years of experience in increasing operational responsibilities or have a minimum of 10 years hands-on experience in Building Engineering Operations.  Candidate must possess a strong working knowledge of building trades, procurement order to invoice processing and leadership responsibilities in an electronic driven environment.

Language Skills:  Ability to read and comprehend instructions, short correspondence and memos.   Ability to write simple correspondence.  Ability to effectively present information one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients and other employees of the organization.  English required, bilingual a plus. 

Reasoning Ability:  Able to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed written or oral instructions.  Ability to deal with problems involving several variables in standardized situations.  Strong analytical skills are a must. 

Computer Skills:  Experience with word processing, spreadsheets, Internet software, email and/or database software preferred.  Microsoft Office skills are required. 

Physical Demands:  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.   

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; use hands to manipulate, handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear.  The employee is frequently required to sit.  The employee is occasionally required to climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; and smell.  The employee is occasionally required to lift up to 20 pounds

jobs.title: Senior Firmware Engineer
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


219 Design is a full-service product development firm. For almost 20 years, we’ve been helping companies invent products that change the world. Our clients are innovators in the fields of medical devices, surgical robotics, consumer products, merchandising, transportation, and more. We are a team of curious and clever problem solvers. 219ers have improved patient outcomes, changed the way we enjoy sports, and revolutionized data transfer - just to name a few. Our spacious headquarters is in Mountain View, CA - the heart of Silicon Valley and a 10 minute walk from Caltrain. We also have offices in Raleigh’s Research Triangle and in San Francisco’s SOMA District.

As a firmware engineer at 219 Design, you will collaborate with software, electrical, and mechanical engineers on a diverse set of projects to make impactful new products come to life. You will have an active role in firmware architecture, development, integration, and testing.

COVID Message: As the world begins to recover from the global pandemic, we continue to grow and deliver on a variety of new projects. Until it is safe to fully reopen, we remain primarily virtual and that includes our interviewing and onboarding processes.  As a distributed team, we already have a built-in system to make you feel welcome and engaged with the whole team through weekly discussion groups, company-wide video calls, and optional game nights. If your pets, kids, or housemates make an appearance, it’s totally fine. We’ve been enjoying the comic relief. Eventually, you will be working onsite but we have always supported a flexible schedule and work from home.  

Equal Opportunity Message: 219 Design is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We value diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment where 219ers thrive.

Job Description
-Ownership of system design and firmware on a variety of projects, ranging from quick-and-dirty proof of concepts to complex medical devices.
-Architect, implement, and validate firmware including integration with complex hardware and mechanical components.
-Participate in code reviews by providing timely feedback to peers in a constructive manner.
-Collaborate with 219ers across engineering disciplines during development.
-Collaborate with colleagues and clients to set objectives, schedules, and deliverables for self or a small team.
-Define and execute tasks required to complete projects with well-defined or open-ended requirements.
-Participate in weekly Software Discussion and Embedded Discussion meetings to discuss best practices and share project triumphs and struggles that could benefit from the input of others. Chime in on our Slack channels when you see an opportunity to help out a colleague.
-Maintain awareness of bigger picture context for 219 Design and our clients while executing tasks.

Qualifications
-BS or MS in software, computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering or a related field.
-4+ years experience as a firmware developer.
-Proficiency with C bare-metal firmware for microcontrollers.
-Successful experience in the development of complex technical systems.
-Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work independently to achieve team success.
-You are authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.

Benefits
Changing jobs is a big deal! We know you need to weigh compensation, job satisfaction, and company culture so we wanted to share some of the things we think make 219 Design unique and a great place to work:
-All the usual benefits like health/dental/vision insurance insurance as well as 401(k) + company match, and paid vacation & holidays. 
-A share of the company’s profit, and ability to shape our company by influencing the types of projects we accept and emerging technology we incorporate
-A very positive work culture.  There’s no finger pointing, we help each other out with technical challenges, and we have each other’s backs.
-Flexible work hours and ability to work remotely.
-Pay for extra hours and ability to take unpaid time off when you need it.
-A professional development budget with on-the-clock time to attend conferences and training of your choosing (within reason).
-An immersive environment of continuous learning through weekly discussion groups, professional development, and project diversity. 
-You will work in one of our great locations! You can’t beat the weather, food, and activities in the Bay Area. Raleigh is a vibrant city less than an hour from the beach with a thriving music and food scene, not to mention affordable homes and some of the best schools in the nation.
-You will have access to tools like 3D printers, laser cutters, mills and lathes, VR equipment, electronics equipment, and more, including for personal projects!
-Transparent financials and leadership.
-Unlimited snacks that you help to choose.

To apply, visit our website at https://www.219design.com/careers/ and click on one of the job links. 
Emailed resumes will not be considered.

jobs.title: Residential Architectural Designer (Kauai) (Koloa/Poipu)
jobs.location: SF bay area / Koloa South Bay Area
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Pu’uwai Design and Construction

We are a leader in the Luxury Custom Residential Design + Build market. Our company’s focus is on designing and building high-end residential projects on the island of Kaua’i. We are looking for an individual who understands custom home building, understands design principles, and can assist in bringing these two disciplines together in comprehensive documents.

The Design Studio works with several CAD based platforms. We primarily generate documents using the Chief Architect program which is a model based residential architectural design platform software.

We are currently seeking a Residential Architectural Designer to join our Design Studio. As Residential Architectural Designer, in partnership with the Design Director, you will be responsible for interpreting, organizing, and executing the conceptual design of a project as well as utilizing creativity, foresight, and judgement to meet project requirements and objectives through a project’s completion. Position of Residential Architectural Designer is not remote. Candidate must be willing to work in our office on the sunny south shore of Kaua’i, Hawai’i.

REQUIRED SKILLS

• Strong knowledge of design, construction methodology, material application, and manufacturer-supplier appropriateness.
• Knowledge of design principles and the ability to interpret design concepts and layouts, including commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures within the profession required.
• Possessing a creative talent in conceptual design and rendering skills by hand and/or computer required.
• Knowledge of building regulations/codes and the ability to research and apply/incorporate into design/technical documents required.
• Knowledge of design techniques, tools, and principles involved in production of precision technical plans, drawings, and 3d computer models required.
• Proven ability to prioritize in order to meet project deadlines and delivery of high quality service to clients.
• Knowledge of architectural building systems required.
• Experience in 3d rendering software (Chief Architect, 3D Max, sketch-up, etc.) preferred.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite required.
• Proficiency in Adobe Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, In-design, Acrobat) required.
• Ability to communicate both verbally and in writing.
• Ability to work in a team environment.
• Ability to effectively meet project deadlines.
• Experience in networking with clients, vendors, dealers preferred.
• Minimal travel may be required.

RESPONSIBILITIES

• Receives project direction from Design Director.
• Coordinates use and tracks shared electronic documentation and files with project team and consultants.
• Coordinates with building department(s) and other authorities having jurisdiction to obtain approvals and/or variances.
• Provides technical support to project team as required.
• Assists in Specification Writing of product research, consulting with manufacturers, evaluating and selecting project related materials.
• Involved in specification set-up and drawing coordination incorporating Pu’uwai Standards.
• Participates in team project meetings to help resolve project issues, coordination with other disciplines, schedule adherence, and technical issues.
• Participates in review of project costs and budgets, adherence to schedule.
• Produces written documentation related to project including meeting documentation, transmittals, and memorandums, while using Pu’uwai standard formats.
• Prepares 2D and 3D presentation/design drawings for client/project team reviews and presentations.

QUALIFICATIONS

• Bachelor’s Degree in architecture required.
• Prior experience (5-10 years) in Custom Residential Design preferred.
• Licensed Architect with current registration in your region preferred but not required.
• Experience with the local Hawai’i market preferred.


LOCATION
Koloa, Hawai’i (Island of Kaua’i)

POSITION TYPE
Full-Time / Salaried

To apply, please click this link:
https://www.ondemandassessment.com/link/index/JB-LB66AYUP9?u=1021358

jobs.title: Architectural Drafter / Architect (Revit Experience Req'd)
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Building Solutions is a Plan / Design / Build firm in San Rafael. We are looking for talented design professionals to create and manage project design, construction documentation and architectural deliverables for high-end residential design projects from schematic design through construction administration.

You have a unique opportunity to be a part of a modern, Revit-based environment, grow your career into a multi-disciplinary, skill set beyond architectural design, including Value Engineering, Real Estate Investing, and Lifespan Analysis.

- Starting in PLAN, your creative skills will inform the client's financial goals from the very beginning of the pre-construction process.

- Moving into DESIGN, your creative and Revit skills will produce increasingly detailed project designs, while integrating Value Engineering as a tool to shape architectural products, AND with the design team FIRMLY in control of the VE process.

By writing our own software and processes, and enhanced by Revit’s capabilities, we have emulated and adapted the modern digital collaborative-intensive techniques that used to be the exclusive purview of skyscrapers and bridges.

- During BUILD, we will once again utilize your strengths to inform the inevitable design changes typical for our industry.

Requirements:

Must have strong Revit skills. This is a 100% Revit position. We do not work in AutoCad or other platforms.
Expertise in REVIT (2016 Minimum, 2018.2 Preferred) with strong experience working with families, detailing, and work sharing
Strong knowledge of wood frame construction principles and details to include foundation systems, electrical, mechanical, and plumbing systems
Experience working with large municipal Planning/ Building departments and their permitting protocols
Knowledge of building components and construction methods and the ability to represent them in a variety of CAD/BIM applications
Applicants must be able to write in a professional manner and communicate effectively and efficiently with all project partners, including consultants, pre-construction staff, field staff, municipalities, and especially clients.
Proficiency in legacy applications with emphasis in AUTOCAD 2012 or higher - including proper layer management, setting up sheets and plotting
Minimum 5 years of Revit Experience
Minimum 1 year AutoCAD Experience
Preferred Education: BA in Architecture, or equal experience
License and stamp a plus, but not necessary.
This is a full-time, hourly pay, 40 hour per week + benefits position. Pay commensurate with skills set. (Open to Part-Time as well).

Please send your resume and pdf examples of your work with a cover letter attached. No links, please.

Remote work is an option for all applicants outside a reasonable commute for our offices in San Rafael, California.

Please note: We are accepting candidates who reside anywhere in the Pacific Time Zone, Alaskan Time Zone, or Mountain Time Zone.

Position Summary:  The Manufacturing Engineer is responsible for defining, developing, and improving manufacturing processes and test equipment.  These processes include job order scheduling, resource definitions, engineering master processes, assembly procedures, work instructions, and training. The Manufacturing Engineer also provides technical product expertise to the Operations Staff and acts as an interface between Operations and Engineering to facilitate the transfer and production of new products and revisions to existing products.

Max Machinery, Inc. is an ISO 9001:2008 certified company.  All employees will assist in the accomplishment of quality objectives.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities (include but not limited to):

•	Interface with Design Engineering to implement new products and design for manufacturability

•	Design, develop, build, and maintain automated test and calibration systems to include both hardware and software system components
•	Performs failure analysis, and root cause investigation to develop corrective actions using statistical methods
•	Establishes and enhances capabilities for new and existing products and processes using continual improvement methodologies
•	Provide technical leadership, assistance, and training to order fulfillment staff
•	Effectively lead and manage multiple projects simultaneously
•	Work closely with other Team Members: Procurement, Engineering, and Quality through the entire product lifecycle
•	Follow safety programs and procedures and maintain equipment and tooling

•	Familiarity with Honing operations and machine shop experience
•	Experience with mechanical systems with computer control required

Job Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

•	Proficiency with assembly and machining methods
•	Experience developing and understanding manufacturing related documents (e.g., policies, procedures, process maps, engineering drawings, etc.); Ability to train others using written work instructions
•	Proven project management, problem solving, and organizational skills
•	Self-directed and internally motivated; ability to self-manage, prioritize, and own assignments and expectations; executes well as an individual contributor and team leader
•	Possess sound mechanical aptitude, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills. Ability to identify complex problems; perform data analysis, evaluate options, and provide solutions
•	Possess excellent communication skills, both oral and written
•	Demonstrates attention to detail, both technical and administrative

Specialized Knowledge, Licenses, Certifications, etc.: 

•	Proficiency in CAD Modeling 
•	Familiarity with Machining Processes and CAM Tools
•	Knowledge, experience, and proficiency using ERP Systems
•	Software programming experience in C or high-level language 
•	Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Access)

Supervisory Responsibilities:  None

Physical Demands:

•	Ability to lift and move up to 50 lbs. without aid
•	Regularly required to sit or stand, bend, reach and move about the facility

Work Environment:

•	Work performed in a shop and office environment
•	Work performed near moving equipment, vehicles, electrical currents, and exposure to chemicals/oils
•	May work at different workstations, may shift from one station to another
•	Employer will supply required personal protective equipment
•	Production work hours are generally 6:30am to 3:00pm

To apply for this position please go to https://maxmachinery.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=32


In addition to a competitive wage, Max Machinery offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes: generous paid time off; medical, vision, and life insurance; 401(k), Flexible Spending Accounts, and voluntary supplemental insurance benefits.

LACO  Associates is seeking a full-time Assistant Land Surveyor/Chief of Party to support our Survey Team. We have offices located in Santa Rosa, Ukiah, Eureka, and Chico. The survey department is currently operating out of the Santa Rosa and Ukiah Offices. LACO has a comprehensive COVID-19 Protection Plan.

The ideal candidate possesses the following:
A minimum of 3 years' experience as a Survey Party Chief
Experience with AutoCAD/Civil 3D, ArcMap, Robotics, and GPS equipment
Must have either a California PLS or LSIT License
Strong communication and project management skills
Initiative with practical solving abilities
Excellent writing skills
Ability to work independently and with a team
Ability to work in the field in steep brushy terrain and move up to 50 pounds
Ability to work in the rain and heat, standing for long periods of time
Current California driver's license in good standing

LACO Associates is a local engineering firm who values community, adaptability, and trusting relationships. LACO utilizes decades of local experience and the complementary strengths of our experts to deliver professional consulting services. Serving Northern California for over 60 years, we’ve grown along with our communities, but what hasn’t changed since we opened our first office in 1954 is the personal connection to our clients.

Benefits Include:
Health insurance (90% premium paid for employee based on composite rate), dental (100% paid for employee), vision (100% paid for employee) 
Retirement plan with up to 4% match
9 paid holidays a year
Starts with 10 days of paid vacation a year
6 sick leave days a year
Flexible Spending Accounts for medical and dependent care
AFLAC
Employee Assistance Program
Professional Development support

Essential Duties and Responsibilities (include but are not limited to):
Perform routine survey work as well as more complex land surveys including boundary surveys, horizontal and vertical control surveys, photogrammetric surveys, and construction staking
Operate and maintain a variety of surveying equipment, instruments, and software, including robotic total stations, global positioning systems, data collection devices, and point processing software
Participate in the post-processing of data collected for boundary, topographic, and construction surveys
Participate in the review, preparation, and/or determination of parcel and subdivision maps, lot line adjustment plats, corner records, record of survey maps, traverse reports, and right-of-way
Interpret and establish compliance with the Subdivision Map Act and the Land Surveyor’s Act
Lead and supervise the survey crew as the Chief of Party and provide information in compliance with department rules, regulations, and guidelines
Perform various field land surveying activities that include monument reconnaissance, monument preservation, monument resets, construction staking, topographic surveying, etc
Draft and/or map various land surveying related documents and/or exhibits using Autodesk Civil 3D software as directed
Solve surveying problems using COGO applications, Civil 3D, and/or handheld software
Assist and support higher level staff to organize, prioritize, and prepare variety of complex surveying documents
Perform the surveying math and calculations
Prepare maps and plans from survey data
Participate in the preparation of legal descriptions and technical correspondence
Read and interpret legal descriptions
Participate in the preparation of corrections for submitted maps, plans, and legal descriptions
Provide survey information to the public regarding projects and programs on an as needed basis
Perform research for land surveying deliverables
Determine completeness and accuracy of data sources to ensure quality of information in automated systems
Attend departmental or technical meetings to keep informed of new survey technological trends and innovations
Maintain survey related records, notes, maps, websites, and other pertinent documents
Organize work, set priorities, and follow up to ensure coordination and completion of assigned survey work

Working Conditions and Physical Demands
Reasonable accommodation can be made to enable people with disabilities to perform the described essential functions.
Occasional overtime may be required
Able to move up to 50 pounds
Prepared to work in inclement weather conditions
Ability to stand and move for long periods of time (over 4 hours)
Ability to work in rugged terrain and move safely over uneven terrain (gravel, rocks, mounds, etc.)
Must be able to remain in a stationary position and be able to work on a computer for long periods of time (over 3 hours, with breaks)

 Our goal is to create the next generation of leading professionals in an environment designed to foster collaboration, creativity, health, and happiness
 We enjoy a family-friendly, energetic, and fun environment
 We empower employees to make their own decisions, creating a respectful workplace where people are treated fairly and are highly motivated to succeed
 Our culture nurtures and celebrates the contributions of each individual
 We aim to cultivate a strong sense of community and dedication
 In 2020, LACO was recognized as a Best Firm to Work For by Zweig Group for the third consecutive year
To learn more about LACO, visit our website at https://www.lacoassociates.us.

What is Pathrise
Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued tech professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their salary, if and only if they get hired.

Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from Google recruiters to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 1000 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.

About the Fellowship
The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for job seekers that helps you land the best job possible in tech.

During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry engineers, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.

Our Mission
We seek to uplift and provide guidance for tech professionals in their career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.

Qualifications
You are interested in getting the best possible job in tech.
You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice whether you need to learn about data structures or UI/UX patterns.
You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Full-Stack, IXL Business Platform
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 12 million students worldwide, is seeking Full-Stack Software Engineers who have a passion for technology and education to help us add new features to our extremely successful educational products and build new, innovative products.

The Business Platform team is responsible for code and tools needed to support our subscription-based business model. IXL's customer and support teams rely on the business platform daily as they work with customers. Our team is responsible for core user data, as well as account and product access provisioning. To support these goals, we build out integrations with databases and other systems used by our largest customers. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions, and we are eager to have you join our team.

International candidates encouraged to apply; H1B sponsorship is available.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

As a Full-Stack Software Engineer, you will build the back-end wiring, application logic, and UI that drive the site. You will find and use the best technologies to add features to our products, as well as to create new products. You’ll be involved in all aspects of the development process and contribute to the entire code base – including design, coding, testing, debugging, and tuning. In addition to working with your fellow engineers, you’ll collaborate with other teams to design amazing products that meet the needs of our users, who are students and teachers all over the world.

TECHNOLOGY

Our server-side stack currently includes Linux, Apache, Java, Scala, Python, and Oracle. Inside browsers, we use a fair amount of JavaScript and CSS. Of course, the specific technologies and languages you use will vary by project and according to your own interests or specialization areas.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

1+ years of experience in software engineering
Bachelor's or advanced degree in computer science or a related discipline
A solid grasp of general programming principles
Excellent programming skills in Java or other object-oriented language
Ability to work both independently and with a wide variety of teams
Knowledge of Unix, Java, SQL, JavaScript, CSS, or source control is a plus
Passion for improving education through technology

ABOUT IXL LEARNING

IXL Learning is a leading educational technology company on a big mission: creating innovative learning experiences that help all learners reach their full potential. IXL's comprehensive curriculum and insightful analytics help more than 500,000 teachers deliver personalized instruction and empower over 12 million students to achieve new learning milestones every day.

At IXL, we’re passionate about our mission of creating the best educational technology that improves learning for all students. We bring that same passion to creating a workplace that values diversity on the basis that all of us bring a unique perspective and experience that advances IXL’s mission.

We strive to increase diversity in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, and physical or mental ability and to continually promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work.
Click here to apply
