We created and maintain the practice engine, where students answer the questions created by the Content team; Analytics, which turns practice data into actionable information for teachers; the Recommendations area, which suggests skills for students to try next; and much more.
You will utilize cutting-edge technologies like React to bring dynamic, user-facing components to life. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions, and we are eager to have you join our team. At IXL, we believe that building a creative and engaging user experience is invaluable to our mission of improving education through technology. 

International candidates encouraged to apply; H1B sponsorship is available.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

Take control of the whole front-end development process from code design to implementation
Collaborate with product managers to build a world-class user experience
Tackle tough design challenges to create reusable user interfaces while writing clean, scalable code
Engineer the front-end architecture that powers our web application
Discover new technologies and establish best practices as the front-end landscape evolves


WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

1+ years of experience in software engineering
Bachelor's or advanced degree in computer science or a related discipline
Expertise in HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Familiarity with at least one JavaScript library or framework (e.g., React, Angular, Ember)
Passion for new technologies, current trends, and best practices in front-end architecture, including performance, accessibility, security, and usability
Enthusiasm for improving education through technology

ABOUT IXL LEARNING

IXL Learning is a leading educational technology company on a big mission: creating innovative learning experiences that help all learners reach their full potential. IXL's comprehensive curriculum and insightful analytics help more than 500,000 teachers deliver personalized instruction and empower over 12 million students to achieve new learning milestones every day.

At IXL, we’re passionate about our mission of creating the best educational technology that improves learning for all students. We bring that same passion to creating a workplace that values diversity on the basis that all of us bring a unique perspective and experience that advances IXL’s mission.

We strive to increase diversity in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, and physical or mental ability and to continually promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work.

jobs.location: SF bay area / Scotts Valley, Ca East Bay Area
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Job Title: Process Engineer 

Job Description
Coordinates all activities related, but not limited, to the areas of New Product Introduction (NPI), procedures, tooling and fixtures, and equipment for the Manufacturing Department.  Will serve as a key stake holder in identification of need, planning, development, and implementation for all technical issues in Engineering and Operations.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities 
• Review and approve new-product-release documentation, ensuring completeness, accuracy, and manufacturability.
• Manage contract review and order entry processes.
• Write and maintain detailed assembly, test, and inspection procedures for the Manufacturing Department in support of the ISO 9001 quality system.
• Review and approve product-change documentation. 
• Identify the need for, design, develop, and maintain the tools and fixtures used by the Manufacturing Department to provide safe and efficient assembly. 
• Identify the need for, select, and purchase the equipment for the Manufacturing Department. Ensure that procedures for maintenance and service exist in the form of work instructions and schedules for the Manufacturing Dept. 
• Coordinate the resolution of technical issues, including new product introductions, existing product changes, assembly procedures, and material. 
• Clearly communicate status to Management for New Product Introduction and critical projects. 
• Participate and assist in product disposition during Material Review Board Meetings. 
• Assist with training of personnel during the introduction of new products. 
• Develop and maintain assembly rates and routings. Ensure that costs are maintained correctly.
• Develop work flows and floor layouts for safe and efficient operations in Manufacturing. 

Education and Experience
• Bachelor's Degree in Engineering and 0-5 years or more of CNC experience and/or equivalent combination of education and experience.
• Previous experience working in a manufacturing environment with a strong Mechanical Engineering skills. 
• Experience with engineering change control systems. 
• Knowledge of machining and fabrication techniques preferred.
• 3D modeling software skills (SolidWorks) preferred. 


About Larkin
Larkin Precision Machining provides design, engineering and manufacturing services for complex, close-tolerance machined components.
We are a Strategic Supplier to leading defense, aerospace, aircraft, helicopter, robotics and medical companies.
We strive to supply our customers with the highest quality, value and service. It is our belief that successful projects begin with successful partnerships.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Core Technology
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 12 million students worldwide, is seeking Software Engineers who have a passion for technology and education to help us build and maintain the core infrastructure for our extremely successful educational products.

The Core Technology team is responsible for researching, implementing, and maintaining back-end frameworks and server-side technologies used by our engineers and applications. The team also monitors and ensures all production and development environments are stable and provides support to other team members with the whole development cycle. Source control, the build and runtime system, as well as deployments, are all responsibilities of the Core Technology team.

As a Software Engineer on our Core Technology team, you’ll work closely with our product teams and have visibility to all parts of our code and products, focusing on performance, uptime, scalability, and reliability. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions, and we are eager to have you join our team.

International candidates encouraged to apply; H1B sponsorship is available.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

Design, build, and maintain scalable and robust infrastructure and services for all of our products
Participate in live performance monitoring, which includes building the tools that allow us to detect and address trouble spots
Troubleshoot and fix production performance and security issues
Develop tools, procedures, and documentation to improve team efficiency


TECHNOLOGY

The Core Technology team contributes to our Java-based code base, especially for back-end code, as well as configuring our web stack (Apache, Tomcat, Struts, Hibernate). Our servers run RedHat Linux and some amount of administration is done on the systems. We use a variety of storage technologies, which we configure and run, including Cassandra, Oracle, Redis, S3, and Zookeeper. Python and Perl scripting are used extensively for our build and deployment systems. An ever-increasing portion of our infrastructure is moving to EC2. So, AWS technologies are also utilized. We use Jenkins and crontab for CI. We investigate and implement new technologies all the time, and this list is always growing.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

Bachelor's or advanced degree in computer science or a related discipline
2+ years of experience in software engineering
Knowledge of Release Management
Excellent programming skills
Strong analytical-reasoning and problem-solving skills
Ability to work both independently and with a wide variety of teams
Passion for improving education through technology

jobs.title: Sr Software Engineer
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Founded in 1965, Telecare is a rapidly growing mental health care company dedicated to making a difference for our clients, the community, and our employees. We offer an array of mental health services to adults with serious mental illness. We partner with public sector entities and behavioral health organizations and have over 155 programs and over 4,300 employees across the country. And we're growing all the time! When you work at Telecare, you help to empower thousands of individuals every day in their journeys of recovery. 

Telecare is proud to have been recognized by The Bay Area Business Times as the 9th Best Place To Work In the Bay Area for 2020! This is the 18th time we have made the list!

Our Corporate Headquarters has over 250 employees in the following departments:  Executive, Development, Finance, Information Systems, Human Resources, Operations, and Marketing & Operations.

Employment Status:  Full-Time

Partial remote work is an option.

Apply Here - https://recruiting2.ultipro.com/TEL1006/JobBoard/2fcbb6f4-e717-17cb-9327-3dd87a55b08d/OpportunityDetail?opportunityId=2172f0ee-749e-4f53-a71f-e4485af9b89b

POSITION SUMMARY

You will be an integral part of Telecare’s special projects IT team.  We are a fun, hardworking “swiss army knife” team that believes in modern development practices and team collaboration.  We aspire to build tools and integrate systems that are flexible, scalable, and make a direct difference in how our doctors, clinicians, and staff provide care and support to thousands of patients daily.

In this role, you will be responsible to build new tools and systems, integrate internal and external systems, enable & perform data analysis, data integration using a variety of tools, technologies, and frameworks, including Web Services/APIs, ASP.Net MVC, C#, .Net Core, jQuery, Angular, SQL Server, SQL SSIS, SAP BI, SAP Data Services, Qlik, Smartsheet, Microsoft O365 services, and other supporting technologies. 

QUALIFICATIONS
Required:
• B.S. in Computer Science, STEM-related degree or combination of equivalent experience
• Four (4) years professional software development experience in a modern programming language such as C#, Java or similar
• Four (4) years of database design and modeling experience
• Four (4) years of SQL/T-SQL experience - must be able to write and debug complex SQL queries
• Solid understanding & demonstrated proficiency in object-oriented (OO) analysis and design principles and patterns
• Knowledge and understanding of SDLC using Agile principles
• Familiar with common source-control tools & methodologies
• Highly detail-oriented with excellent analytical skills
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Ability to work well on a team as well as independently
• Must possess a highly positive and service-oriented approach to working both internally and externally
• Proven ability to troubleshoot and problem solve
• Strong understanding of technology with a natural inquisitiveness
• Must be at least 18 years of age
• All opportunities at Telecare are contingent upon successful completion and receipt of acceptable results of the applicable post-offer physical examination, 2-step PPD test for tuberculosis, acceptable criminal background clearances, excluded party sanctions, and degree or license verification. If the position requires driving, a valid driver's license, a motor vehicle clearance, and proof of auto insurance is required at the time of employment and must be maintained throughout employment. Additional regulatory, contractual, or local requirements may apply

Preferred:
• Experience working with REST APIs
• Experience with UI/UX design and development
• Experience with JavaScript libraries/frameworks such as jQuery, Angular, Node.js and React.
• Experience with cloud development or at least an understanding of the Azure Cloud platform and services.
• Experience with Reporting tools like Microsoft SSRS and Crystal Reports
• Experience with SharePoint (on-premise or Online)
• Experience with healthcare technology services, with emphasis on behavioral health, public health or other human service settings
• Experience with Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
• Demonstrate the Telecare mission, purpose, values, and beliefs in everyday language and contact with the internal and external stakeholders
• Design, develop, test, deploy, and maintain business applications built with a variety of technologies and frameworks
• Write well-documented, testable, and high-quality code
• Liaison with Business Analysts and customers to analyze business requirements
• Manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables
• Maintain a working knowledge of new uses for and new features of the applications and underlying technical components
• Ensures that problems or system issues are prioritized and addressed in a timely manner and status is communicated to affected users and IT Management
• Communicate clearly, insure instructions are clearly understood.
• Attends all team meetings
• Demonstrates a good rapport and cooperative working relationships with all members of the team; respond to co-workers expressing concerns and promote group morale
• Continually focuses on assigned tasks and seeks and implements improvements as necessary
• Demonstrates a knowledge of Telecare's customers including clients/residents, families and governmental agencies in all interactions and conduct
• Acts in a professional manner, always demonstrating respect and understanding of the community and fellow employees
• Completes and follows through with tasks and assignments, meeting expected deadlines
• Stays current with latest technical findings, new products, and software enhancements through trade journals, attendance at seminars and other means

Duties and responsibilities may be added, deleted and/or changed at the discretion of management.

SKILLS
• Exceptional interpersonal skills; able to effectively deal with diverse personalities
• Excellent oral and written ability
• Exceptional organizational skills and proven ability to manage projects and meet deadlines
• Strong analytical skills and demonstrated ability to translate loosely defined requirements into concrete report writing requirements

PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The physical demands here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, squat, twist, bend, reach, and carry items weighing 10 pounds or less as well as to frequently sit and do simple and power grasping. The position requires manual deviation, repetition and dexterity and to occasionally drive. Visual requirements include computers and books exposure.

EOE AA M/F/V Disability

jobs.title: Project Engineer / Project Administrator
jobs.location: SF bay area /  North Bay / Marin
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


We are a General Contractor specializing in high-end residential construction with projects ranging from $100,000 to $25 million. We pride ourselves on our integrity and commitment to quality throughout every step of the process, and you should too! 

The Project Engineer (PE) / Project Administrator (PA) position would work collaboratively with their assigned Project Managers in the management, coordination, scheduling and overall organization of their projects. The PE/PA is a valued member of the Project Team, which typically consists of a Project Manager, Foreman/Superintendent, and Field crew internally, as well as Clients, Architects and Subcontractors outside the office.

Project Engineer/Administrator Responsibilities may include:
• Assisting with preparation of project estimates, schedules, budgets and contracts
• Assembling and distributing bid packages to Subcontractors
• Inputting final contract/budget amounts into accounting software
• Jobsite set up assistance (coordinating with Foremen to ensure they have proper posters, Wi-Fi, field office; safety equipment, etc.)
• Drafting subcontracts and subcontract change orders; managing signatures, and required documents from subs; and scanning, filing and distributing to project team.
• Scanning and filing project drawings, permits and documents
• Ensuring all documentation is maintained, input and saved appropriately
• Running budget and other project reports
• Attending project stakeholder meetings and taking notes / preparing meeting minutes
• Assembling and helping maintain PM Job Binders/folders
• Compiling end of project warranty packages for Clients
• Other tasks as needed by PM for the smooth running of the project
• Providing general software and office machine support to the rest of the team
• Other office responsibilities (such as ordering supplies, organizing, maintenance, etc.) as needed


Helpful Knowledge / Experience:

• Familiarity with construction industry procedures, processes and terminology
• Multitasking and organization skills are a must
• Fast learner with a high level of attention to detail
• Able to meet deadlines and handle the ebb and flow of urgent tasks with grace

We believe in hiring for culture and training that person to the duties at hand. We are a family oriented company that highly values a healthy work/life balance and truly believes in taking care of it's employees. Many employees who are hired stay for decades and we are looking for the right fit. Compensation will depend on experience and new hires will become eligible for certain benefits that can be negotiated. If you are interested, please send us an email using the Craigslist link above and we will reach out. Please include a personal introduction and a resume listing previous work experience.

Thank you!

We are a growing and fun small structural engineering firm in the east bay and greater bay area and we are looking to hire a structural designer. 

The firm works on a diverse mix of custom residential, multi-family, and commercial projects. We offer a flexible work schedule and ask for a high level of responsibility in return. All employees are their own project leads in responsible charge for their projects with supportive co-pilot support/mentorship. 

Someone who'd work well on our team would: 
• Be a self-starter that requires little management (we are operating completely remotely at this time) 
• Have good communication skills to engage with clients for project coordination and can ask for help when needed
• Have a couple years of engineering design experience.

BENEFITS WE OFFER:
• Competitive salary (Pay depends on experience)
• Flexibility to work from home
• 401(k) plan with 3% annual company contribution
• Paid Time Off, Holiday and sick pay
• Fully paid medical insurance for employees
• An allowance for continued education

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:
• Being in responsible charge of leading a project to completion
• Preparing calculation package for permit submittal
• Preparing plans and details for residential/commercial projects, mostly wood-framed
• Team members are all project leads and will be asked to manage calculations and plan package for each job. 

QUALIFICATIONS
• Experience with above listed responsibilities
• Basic CAD fluency
• Familiar with use of Enercalc, RISA and other engineering software
• Strong knowledge of timber design and previous wood-framed design experience

In order to apply, please respond to this posting with a cover letter and resume.

Reali
Senior Backend Developer, Server Engineer, San Francisco, Bay Area
Job Label: Senior Backend Developer, Server Engineer, San Francisco, Bay Area
At Reali.com we're here to delight homeowners at every stage of their lives. Reali is here to make home buying and selling simple, affordable, and stress-free. We were founded to develop a seamless, transparent, and highly efficient residential real estate and homeownership experience by partnering technology with a customer-centric team and years of real estate, loans, escrow, and business experiences.

As a Senior Backend (Server) Developer with our Engineering Team at Reali, you will be collaborating to develop a cutting-edge platform for the real estate marketplace.

This position is ideal for an energetic, creative individual and collaborative team player, who would like to take on a wide range of challenging projects in an exciting and dynamic atmosphere.

You will take part in this revolution, from the comfort of your office near San Mateo, CA

What you’ll do:

As a Senior Backend (Server) Developer you’ll be an important part of an agile team of skilled and experienced developers, working together to build the next-generation Backend infrastructure that will scale the Reali solution to millions of consumers.

In addition, you will also help to maintain and refactor our legacy products and take it to the next generation, while improving performance, scalability, and availability.

This is a unique position putting you in the center of our system and the development cycle.
 
Reali is made up of experts and technologists who collaborate to deliver transparent, stress-free real estate solutions for buyers, sellers, and agents. Headquartered in San Mateo, CA and founded in 2016, Reali supports the entire transaction process from beginning to end with full-service offerings including loans, mortgages, real estate, escrow, title and more! By merging decades of industry expertise with proprietary technology, the Reali team has developed a suite of intelligent products to take the complexity and uncertainty out of buying a home. Reali has won multiple awards and has cemented a winning reputation with an A+ from the BBB.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

At least 5 years of relevant experience.
Hands-on experience building a large-scale cloud backend system on a major public cloud (AWS – advantage).
Ability to design, develop and modify clean RESTful micro-services and backend applications that conform to company standards and best practices.
Hands-on experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g.: MongoDB,PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch).
Expert in Scala or Java.
Will and ability to partner with remote teams.


This experience is a plus:

Experience building a large-scale system using JVM.
Experience using NodeJS.
Experience with big data solutions.

We are a small Sacramento based firm with under 10 employees. Currently we are seeking an intermediate Architect to work for our Sacramento office.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
• Support the Principal and/or Project Manager in development of the design and detailing

MOXII Technical Co-Founder

MOXII is revolutionizing the way brands market & sell their products to retailers by reinventing the model that brings them to market. We’re bringing passionate consumers behind the scenes and empowering them with the ability to represent brands in a sales capacity. Finding success for both the brand and themselves, these passionate consumers tap into their category knowledge and interest as the secret selling ingredient in which brand love becomes the invaluable currency.

Manifested as a digital platform, MOXII crowdsources and converts these high-influence consumers by carefully matching them with brands that align with their passions and then transforms them into hyper localized, affordable, high-touch networks of sales teams across the country.

Located in Half Moon Bay, California, MOXII is the ultimate celebration of brand & product love.

About the Role:

MOXII is seeking a technical leader to join our founding team. This role will form the backbone of our development processes and engineering infrastructure and is perfect for someone with a passion for building scalable products from the ground up.

This is a fast paced role in an ambitious team. Responsibilities are focused on leading the development of system architecture and the associated code. Additional responsibilities will require the ability to budget and determine resources in alignment with the needs of a startup business.

MOXII currently utilizes outsourced engineers to develop our MVP. You will inherit this early product and are expected to reduce dependency on 3rd-parties by moving development in-house. This includes direct involvement with the platform development as well as the recruitment of additional engineers.

MOXII is currently being developed under a mobile-web architecture with future iterations potentially in iOS/Android.

As a critical role within the business there will be a significant equity opportunity.

Salesforce, Zoom)

● Manage production infrastructure, security, monitoring, logging etc.
● Assess and implement open source and third party vendor solutions.
● Improve test coverage, implement CI/CD and build out QA processes.

Who You Are:
This is an opportunity for a goal-driven individual excited to be on the ground floor of an ambitious business. You should be passionate about architecting and coding platforms that are both scalable and easily modifiable. You know time is of the essence, yet produce clean and quality code. You are data driven and very passionate about your craft. At MOXII, you will get the opportunity to use all of these assets to build a system from the ground up with a team eager to support you

performance

HireArt is helping the world's largest social network find an Integration Verification Engineer to join its world-class team of researchers and engineers. In this role, you will use your digital design, physical design, and verification skills to integrate state of the art machine-learning accelerators into custom SOCs. You will also contribute to power and performance optimization through various simulation-based verification processes (i.e. power-aware, gate-level, and performance) and work closely with SOC and IP teams to execute functional and physical integration test plans.


The ideal candidate will have a background as a digital design engineer, experience with top-level integration, and a Masters in Electrical Engineering/Computer Science. All candidates must have a Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent experience, 2+ years System Verilog OVM/UVM DV and power-aware verification experience, and proficient knowledge of at least one procedural programming language (C, C++, Python, etc.).

Execute verification plans for power and performance targets, as well as tests for the company's custom IP.
Execute internal integration test plans, SOC vendor test plans, and use-case testing.
Drive gate-level simulation health for internal netlists and SOC vendor netlists.
Implement scalable power-aware and gate-level simulation infrastructure leveraging test benches in System Verilog.
Keep track of power state coverage metrics and all bugs.
Implement self-testing directed and random tests.
Support post silicon bringup and debug activities.

Assigns, directs and reviews work of staff;
Performs highly skilled and complex electrical, plumbing, mechanical and building inspection work to enforce codes;
Investigates complaints concerning new construction or alteration work, interprets codes and regulations, explains inspection program, and gives advice relevant to construction and repair methods and materials to owners, architects, engineers, contractors, lending institutions, realtors and utility companies;
Issues "Stop Work" and "No Occupancy" orders, writes citations, warning letters, Notice and Orders, and carries negligence cases though prosecution channels where appropriate in noncompliance situations;
Maintains records and files of inspections made; performs field surveys and prepares reports;
Serves as departmental expert in all areas of specialties and assists other inspectors as requested;
Inspects sites and buildings before and during construction or alterations for adequacy of plans, use of occupancy, compliance with regulations, and validity of permits;
Inspects construction or alteration in progress for conformity with approved land use and zoning laws, related codes and regulations, and for safe application of construction and installation practices; makes final inspections to clear permits;
Provides technical and referral information to contractors, owners, architects and engineers, on construction and alteration methods and materials and reviews and approves alternate methods or changes in plans as needed during actual construction or installation;
May perform general inspections of work under permit to enforce building, plumbing, mechanical, electrical and related codes and regulations;
May reviews plans and specifications for building and related construction, installations, repairs, replacement and alteration for compliance with codes.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Education
Equivalent to graduation from high school.

AND 

Experience
Five years of journey-level experience as a combination inspector with a public jurisdiction. College level coursework in the inspection field is desirable.

AND

Current certifications by the International Code Council (ICC) as a Building Inspector, Electrical Inspector, Plumbing Inspector, and Mechanical Inspector are required.
Must be able to travel to various locations within and outside the City of Berkeley to meet the program needs and to fulfill the job responsibilities.
When driving on City business, maintenance of a valid California driver's license and satisfactory driving record is required.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

KNOWLEDGE OF: Principles and methods used in all trades regulated by the building, plumbing, mechanical and electrical codes, including methods and materials of construction, for projects involving large-scale construction and installation of equipment and appliances; laws, ordinances and codes regulating building, plumbing, mechanical and electrical materials and methods of construction; appropriate safety and fire prevention methods for applicable work assignments; related craft areas that assist in analyzing and providing expertise in the assigned inspection areas; and basic supervisory principles and practices.

ABILITY TO: Review plans and specifications for building, plumbing, mechanical and electrical inspections; inspect building sites, especially as involved in assigned inspections for large-scale construction, alteration, repair or enforcement of particular craft or inspection program areas;  deal courteously and communicating effectively with a variety of individuals in the course of work; perform non-structural plan review; resolve job-related problems with property owners and contractors, tenants, architects, engineers, realtors and representatives of City and outside organizations and firms;  prepare clear and concise written reports;  provide expertise and assistance in prosecution of cases within assigned inspection areas; provide lead direction and training to other inspection staff; and make sound independent judgments in complex, difficult inspection work within established guidelines.

APPLICATION PROCESS:
Applicants must submit the following:

1. CITY OF BERKELEY EMPLOYMENT APPLICATION
2. RESPONSES TO THE SUPPLEMENTAL QUESTIONNAIRE
3. COPIES OF LICENSE(S) / CERTIFICATION(S)

All materials must be received in our office no later than the closing date, at 5:00 p.m. PST.  Postmarks, faxes and incomplete applications will not be accepted.  Resumes are not a substitute for a completed application.

Training & Experience
Candidates who meet the minimum qualifications will be evaluated based on the information provided in a separate questionnaire which will be delivered via email on the week July 5, 2021.

Applicants who achieve passing scores will have their names placed on an employment eligible list that hiring department(s) will use to conduct final selection interviews.  Hiring Department(s) will contact applicants directly if selected to participate in their hiring/selection process.

Candidates under final consideration for employment with the City should expect to undergo an employment background / reference check that may include, but is not limited to: employment history, confirmation of educational credentials and degrees, licenses including driver's license, registrations, certificates, and other credentials as part of the appointment process. Some positions, depending on the nature of the work, also require a credit check and a review of Summary Criminal History obtained from the State Department of Justice through Live Scan Fingerprinting.

DISCLAIMER: The provisions of this bulletin do not constitute a contract, expressed or implied, and any provisions contained in this bulletin may be modified or revoked without notice. Tests may consist of any combination of written, oral or other exercises or assessment procedures that test content. Components may include, but are not necessarily limited to, typing, math, reading, writing and analytical skills; problem solving ability; computer and software proficiency, or any other job-related knowledge, skill, ability or qualification. The City may, without notice, change or eliminate any particular assessment component or combination of components as needs dictate.

All City employees are required to provide services as Disaster Service Workers in the event of an emergency / disaster.

Exam Access Accommodation: In compliance with local, state and federal laws and regulations, the City of Berkeley will employ and promote qualified individuals without regard to disability. The City is committed to making reasonable accommodations in the examination process and in the work environment. Individuals requesting reasonable accommodations in the examination process must do so no later than the final filing date for receipt of applications, otherwise it may not be possible to arrange accommodations for the selection process. Such requests should be addressed to the Department of Human Resources | (510) 981-6800 |  2180 Milvia Street, 1st Floor, Berkeley CA 94704.

Alternative Application Formats: This application material is available in alternative formats upon request. Alternative formats include audio-format, braille, large print, electronic text, etc. Please contact the ADA Coordinator, 2180 Milvia Street, Berkeley | Phone: (510) 981-6300 | TTY: (510) 981-6347| allow 7-10 days for production of the material in an alternative format.

The City of Berkeley is an EEO/ADA Employer.


STATEMENT OF ECONOMIC INTERESTS: Incumbents in this classification must file a Statement of Economic Interests in accordance with State regulations.

At Toyota Research Institute (TRI), we’re working to build a future where everyone has the freedom to move, engage, and explore with a focus on reducing vehicle collisions, injuries, and fatalities. Join us in our mission to improve the quality of human life through advances in artificial intelligence, automated driving, robotics, and materials science. We’re dedicated to building a world of “mobility for all” where everyone, regardless of age or ability, can live in harmony with technology to enjoy a better life. Through innovations in AI, we’ll... ● Develop vehicles incapable of causing a crash, regardless of the actions of the driver. ● Develop technology for vehicles and robots to help people enjoy new levels of independence, access, and mobility. ● Bring advanced mobility technology to the market faster. ● Discover new materials that will make drive batteries and hydrogen fuel cells smaller, lighter, less expensive and more powerful. Our work is guided by a dedication to safety – in how we research, develop, and validate the performance of vehicle technology to benefit society. As a subsidiary of Toyota, TRI is fueled by a diverse and inclusive community of people who carry invaluable leadership, experience, and ideas from industry-leading companies. Over half of our technical team carries Ph.D. degrees. We’re continually searching for the world’s best talent ‒ people who are ready to define the new world of mobility with us! We strive to build a company that helps our people thrive, achieve work-life balance, and bring their best selves to work. At TRI, you will have the opportunity to enjoy the best of both worlds ‒ a fun start-up environment with brilliant people who enjoy solving tough problems and the financial backing to successfully achieve our goals. If you’re passionate about working with smart people to make cars safer, enable the elderly to age in place, or design alternative fuel sources, TRI is the place for you. ‒ Start your impossible with us.

Are you looking for a great place to work in a fun environment that truly gives you an opportunity to grow in your career? Do want to be valued as an employee and ready to work for a company who wants to hear about your creative engineering solutions and implement them? Do you embody our core values of trust, respect, quality, service and innovation? If you share our values and ideals, and you are motivated to help create great places for people to live, work and play, then look no further than Munselle Civil Engineering.

Munselle Civil Engineering & DVC Group (MCE/DVC) is a small civil engineering and land surveying firm servicing Sonoma, Napa, Marin, Mendocino, Solano, Contra Costa, San Mateo and San Francisco counties. We currently have immediate openings for Senior Civil Engineers and Civil Project Managers to join our team. Under the supervision of the Principal(s), the Senior Civil Engineer / Project Manager will actively participate in the supervision of the design and technical activities required for various types of single family home, residential subdivisions, commercial and industrial developments, vineyards, winery, reservoirs, septic and public works projects.

MCE/DVC has offices in Healdsburg, Mill Valley and Ukiah and would consider applicants for any location.  We are also open to remote work opportunities.  Should you be interested in our firm, please do not shy away because of location!  Any interested and qualified persons, regardless of location, are encouraged to contact us.  

**Future partnership possibilities may be considered for interested and qualified individual(s)**

Any and all inquiries will remain private and in the strictest of confidence.  

Responsibilities (experience in and/or ability to learn):  
•	Supervise and participate in the design and preparation of engineering plans
o	Grading and drainage plans
o	Topographic Mapping (understanding of)
o	Erosion Control Plans
o	Utility Plans
o	Construction Management Plans
•	Supervise and participate in the prepare project technical reports and specifications
•	Review project design criteria
•	Gather data and design information needed for project design and management
•	Supervise, review and participate in the preparation of design calculations
•	Coordination with clients and public agencies
•	Proposal preparation, budget tracking, invoice review

Requirements:
•	Bachelor’s degree (B.S.) Civil Engineering or bachelor’s Degree (B.S) of an equivalent discipline from a four-year college or university and
•	Civil engineering private development design experience totaling 5(+) years.
•	Successful candidates will have a well-developed problem-solving, decision-making, communication and team building skills.
•	Proficiency in AutoCAD and/or Civil 3D software required.
•	Microsoft Office
Why work for Munselle Civil Engineering?
•	Growth Opportunity – we encourage growth within the organization and promote from within while promoting healthy personal time.
•	Professional Development – we support our staff in pursuing industry related certification & professional licensure.
•	Excellent culture and team dynamic – employee outings, company picnics, company happy hour and a fun and engaging environment.
•	Flexible Work Location – we are open to any/all location possibilities (in office, you work from your distant location, your home or other).  
•	Competitive Salary and discretionary annual bonus.  Salary:  $90,000 - $125,000, depending on experience.  
•	Benefits include medical/dental, PTO, 401k (with company contributions/matching), long/short term disability, paid vacation, sick and holiday.
We have an amazing team of smart and dedicated staff and management at MCE/DVC and we are excited to share our company culture with you!

jobs.title: Manufacturing Engineer
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Position Summary:  The Manufacturing Engineer is responsible for defining, developing, and improving manufacturing processes and test equipment.  These processes include job order scheduling, resource definitions, engineering master processes, assembly procedures, work instructions, and training. The Manufacturing Engineer also provides technical product expertise to the Operations Staff and acts as an interface between Operations and Engineering to facilitate the transfer and production of new products and revisions to existing products.

Max Machinery, Inc. is an ISO 9001:2008 certified company.  All employees will assist in the accomplishment of quality objectives.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities (include but not limited to):

•	Interface with Design Engineering to implement new products and design for manufacturability
•	Act as a Supply Chain partner collaborating with Procurement and Quality in identifying, sourcing, qualifying, assessing, and interfacing with suppliers
•	Design/selection of assembly tooling, fixtures, and machines to include both hardware and software system components
•	Design, develop, build, and maintain automated test and calibration systems to include both hardware and software system components
•	Performs failure analysis, and root cause investigation to develop corrective actions using statistical methods
•	Establishes and enhances capabilities for new and existing products and processes using continual improvement methodologies
•	Provide technical leadership, assistance, and training to order fulfillment staff
•	Effectively lead and manage multiple projects simultaneously
•	Work closely with other Team Members: Procurement, Engineering, and Quality through the entire product lifecycle
•	Follow safety programs and procedures and maintain equipment and tooling

Education and Experience:

•	Bachelor’s Degree in Manufacturing Engineering or similar and at least 2 years of experience in a        manufacturing assembly environment
•	Familiarity with Honing operations and machine shop experience
•	Experience with mechanical systems with computer control required

Job Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

•	Proficiency with assembly and machining methods
•	Experience developing and understanding manufacturing related documents (e.g., policies, procedures, process maps, engineering drawings, etc.); Ability to train others using written work instructions
•	Proven project management, problem solving, and organizational skills
•	Self-directed and internally motivated; ability to self-manage, prioritize, and own assignments and expectations; executes well as an individual contributor and team leader
•	Possess sound mechanical aptitude, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills. Ability to identify complex problems; perform data analysis, evaluate options, and provide solutions
•	Possess excellent communication skills, both oral and written
•	Demonstrates attention to detail, both technical and administrative

Specialized Knowledge, Licenses, Certifications, etc.: 

•	Proficiency in CAD Modeling 
•	Familiarity with Machining Processes and CAM Tools
•	Knowledge, experience, and proficiency using ERP Systems
•	Software programming experience in C or high-level language 
•	Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Access)

Supervisory Responsibilities:  None

Physical Demands:

•	Ability to lift and move up to 50 lbs. without aid
•	Regularly required to sit or stand, bend, reach and move about the facility

Work Environment:

•	Work performed in a shop and office environment
•	Work performed near moving equipment, vehicles, electrical currents, and exposure to chemicals/oils
•	May work at different workstations, may shift from one station to another
•	Employer will supply required personal protective equipment
•	Production work hours are generally 6:30am to 3:00pm

To apply for this position please go to https://maxmachinery.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=32


In addition to a competitive wage, Max Machinery offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes: generous paid time off; medical, vision, and life insurance; 401(k), Flexible Spending Accounts, and voluntary supplemental insurance benefits.

jobs.description:

Summary:  Responsible for the technical analysis and development of interconnect solutions to design challenges in response to specific customer needs and/or in support of market driven product goals.  These may include new product & process development, application of specific modifications to existing products and/or improvement of existing processes to reduce cost, improve manufacturability or improve quality. Markets served include Medical, Test & Measurement, Oil & Gas, Entertainment, Autonomous vehicles, Aeronautics and Military.

DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES
•	Develops and validates competitive product solutions that satisfy specific customer.  Products typically include connectors employing electrical, fiber optic and pneumatic connections plus cable and harness assemblies, box builds, integration of electronics and filtering into connection systems.  
•	Design Engineering technical lead on project teams responsible for completing design related tasks including part/assembly CAD modeling, proof of concept, building prototypes, costs, thermal and geometric fit considerations from the concept phase through production following a Stage Gate process
•	Constructs and evaluates prototypes, including testing and analysis for design verification, product validation, and achievement of performance requirements 
•	Provides technical support on new products, customer applications, tooling and manufacturing issues 
•	Provides guidance to the assembly teams as required for new designs and processes 
•	Develops and validates new processes and equipment to meet customer needs and expand value add capabilities 
•	Analyzes and develops solutions to quality and/or manufacturing problems 
•	Designs and conducts experiments, writes technical reports and/or papers 
•	Co-Develops quality, test, and inspection plans 
•	Leads effective failure mode and effects analyses, EFMEA, manufacturability studies, make vs. buy recommendations, and cost estimating
•	Some travel required
•	Other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS 

•	Bachelor’s degree (BSME preferred) or work experience in related industry 
•	Experience: Two to five years  with small, precision-manufactured electro-mechanical products,  electrical and/or fiber optic connectors preferred.  
•	Ability to apply mechanical engineering principles to create new product concepts, detailed designs, modifications of mechanical and electro-mechanical components or systems
•	Initiate comprehensive and effective troubleshooting and problem analysis methods
•	Familiarity with quality concepts / tools including but not limited to:  Six Sigma, Lean Manufacturing, Design for Manufacture (DFM), Design / Process Failure Mode Analysis (FMEA) (ISO 14971 Risk Management), Statistical Process Control (SPC) and 5S desired.  
•	Lead or engage in effective and professional communications on both technical and non-technical matters
•	Experience using 3D CAD/CAE software, Autodesk Inventor® CAD software preferred for the creation and analysis of designs
•	Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Products 

Company Info:   LEMO, a privately owned Swiss company, is a global leader in the design and manufacture of precision custom connection solutions since 1946. Providing high-quality push-pull connectors that can be found in a variety of challenging application environments including medical, industrial control, test & measurement, broadcast/audio/video, and telecommunications. LEMO also provides specialty cable and wire, cable assembly services, prototyping and custom designs.

LEMO USA, a subsidiary of LEMO, is located in Sonoma County among the rolling hills of Northern California's wine county, centrally located just 45 minutes north of San Francisco.  LEMO USA provides Sales, Marketing, Engineering and Cable Assembly Services at their facilities located in Rohnert Park.

LEMO requires an uncompromising commitment to QUALITY, EXCELLENCE, and INNOVATION. As such, we encourage and invest in each employee to promote responsibility, personal growth, and integrity. 

LEMO is an Equal Opportunity Employer

•	Design Engineering technical lead on project teams responsible for completing design related tasks including part/assembly CAD modeling, proof of concept, building prototypes, costs, thermal and geometric fit considerations from the concept phase through production following a Stage Gate process
•	Constructs and evaluates prototypes, including testing and analysis for design verification, product validation, and achievement of performance requirements 
•	Provides technical support on new products, customer applications, tooling and manufacturing issues 
•	Provides guidance to the assembly teams as required for new designs and processes 
•	Develops and validates new processes and equipment to meet customer needs and expand value add capabilities 
•	Analyzes and develops solutions to quality and/or manufacturing problems 
•	Designs and conducts experiments, writes technical reports and/or papers 
•	Co-Develops quality, test, and inspection plans 
•	Leads effective failure mode and effects analyses, EFMEA, manufacturability studies, make vs. buy recommendations, and cost estimating
•	Some travel required
•	Other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS 

•	Bachelor’s degree (BSME preferred) or work experience in related industry 
•	Experience: Two to five years  with small, precision-manufactured electro-mechanical products,  electrical and/or fiber optic connectors preferred.  
•	Ability to apply mechanical engineering principles to create new product concepts, detailed designs, modifications of mechanical and electro-mechanical components or systems
•	Initiate comprehensive and effective troubleshooting and problem analysis methods
•	Familiarity with quality concepts / tools including but not limited to:  Six Sigma, Lean Manufacturing, Design for Manufacture (DFM), Design / Process Failure Mode Analysis (FMEA) (ISO 14971 Risk Management), Statistical Process Control (SPC) and 5S desired.  
•	Lead or engage in effective and professional communications on both technical and non-technical matters
•	Experience using 3D CAD/CAE software, Autodesk Inventor® CAD software preferred for the creation and analysis of designs
•	Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Products 

Company Info:   LEMO, a privately owned Swiss company, is a global leader in the design and manufacture of precision custom connection solutions since 1946. Providing high-quality push-pull connectors that can be found in a variety of challenging application environments including medical, industrial control, test & measurement, broadcast/audio/video, and telecommunications. LEMO also provides specialty cable and wire, cable assembly services, prototyping and custom designs.

LEMO USA, a subsidiary of LEMO, is located in Sonoma County among the rolling hills of Northern California's wine county, centrally located just 45 minutes north of San Francisco.  LEMO USA provides Sales, Marketing, Engineering and Cable Assembly Services at their facilities located in Rohnert Park.

LEMO requires an uncompromising commitment to QUALITY, EXCELLENCE, and INNOVATION. As such, we encourage and invest in each employee to promote responsibility, personal growth, and integrity. 

LEMO is an Equal Opportunity Employer

HireArt is helping an innovative cloud storage company hire a Digital Product Manager to join its Web team. In this role, you will leverage consumer and business data to help identify areas of business opportunity for our client's visitor website, while leading Engineering and ITS in identifying, understanding and resolving web related technical issues.
This role will lean heavily on deriving actionable information from research and online behavioral data, user journey mapping, and digital marketing, so the ideal candidate will have experience in these areas. You should also have experience defining and driving adherence to web standards.
As a Digital Product Manager, you will:

Develop detailed requirements to guide the development of website capabilities in coordination with Web Producers, UX/UI Designers, and Analytics team.
Work with Web Producers and development teams to ensure website components are built according to requirements and best practices.
Regularly monitor web traffic, onsite behavior, and business outcomes.
Track and regularly report performance on website conversion rates, customer acquisitions, and new/retention revenue to various internal audiences.
Use data-driven insights to identify initiatives meant to deliver business impact and create business cases based on clearly identified goals and targets.
Drive investigations of website performance issues, potential anomalies, etc.
Assist in creating and maintaining web policies and processes to ensure best practices and compliance requirements are observed/followed.


If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here:
https://www.hireart.com/jobs/34a6fecd/apply

A Bachelor’s or Master’s in Computer Science or experience as a Software Engineer, Designer, or startup founder
4+ years website product management experience (i.e. experience crafting scalable digital platforms)
Experience with Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), Adobe Target, and similar systems
Knowledge of UI/UX design and digital marketing principles
Ability to work effectively in highly collaborative environments and derive actionable insights from website behavior and business data
Crafts clear and compelling recommendations, supported by strong analysis and business logic, to gain cross functional support
Passionate about understanding customer needs and strongly motivated to tackle customer problems 
Obsessive about potential impact of web experience details (e.g. features descriptions, interfaces, etc.) on user take-rates and user experience satisfaction
Effective communicating cross-functionally (e.g., development & technology teams, business teams) as well as across all levels within the organization
Ability to juggle multiple initiatives, and shift priorities as needed
Maintain and update product roadmaps
Experience with TOPO/Gartner a plus

jobs.title: CAD Technician / Draftsperson
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Job Description
Date:		 07/07/2021								

Job Title:	 CAD Technician / Draftsperson		

Department:   Engineering				

Reports to:	 Hugo Reichmuth, Senior Design Engineer	

Position Summary:

CAD Technician will generate detailed shop drawings for millwork, casework, and other building components as directed by senior staff. 

Required Documents: Please submit samples of your work along with your application: shop drawings, millwork, casework construction, installation drawings, etc.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
•	Produce construction documents utilizing computer-aided design (CAD) software such as AutoCAD and Inventor. permit sets for submittal to local jurisdictions.
•	Documents include: floor plans, sections, elevations, utility plan, and details
•	Utilize AutoCAD and Inventor software to design and create detailed and accurate 3D models and 2D manufacturing drawings for interior casework and joinery.
•	Draft and layout joinery designs, generate plot files, and release production drawings to the shop in a timely manner.
•	Perform field measurements and collaborate with field operations 
•	Convey important design ideas and instructions to both clients and production to get projects done in a timely manner.
•	Coordination for space allocation for mechanical, electrical, HVAC, and audio components within tight space constraints.
•	Perform as-built drawing revisions.

Required knowledge, skills, and abilities:
•	Ability to work in a team environment and collaborate effectively with shop personnel, sales personnel, and customers.
•	Sharp and creative eye for details, along with the ability to take a verbal request and transpose it graphically and visually.
•	Must possess the knowledge of materials and methods, and construction techniques used in the construction or repair of residential buildings and/or other structures.
•	Must be able to organize work, listen well, take accurate notes, and process directions. Then, take those elements and execute them per a schedule as directed by senior staff.
•	Strong verbal and written communication skills.
•	Strong ability to work within a team setting, inclusive of other’s ideas, and a willingness to cooperate.
•	Proficiency in AutoCAD, Microsoft Office, and Adobe.
•	Precision and accuracy (beyond standard architectural practice) are required.
•	Interface with design, engineering, and production staff in a professional manner.
•	Follow and maintain disciplined electronic filing.

Education and Experience:
•	Bachelor’s degree in design or engineering preferred
•	Associate’s degree plus two (2) years previous experience will be considered
•	One (1) year of prior woodworking or millwork experience strongly preferred
•	Experience with AutoCAD (2D and 3D) and Inventory required
•	Understanding of standard building construction methods
•	Three (3) years of prior design / engineering experience with projects that extend into fabrication and installation support
•	Must be able to demonstrate basic residential construction knowledge
•	Experience in residential / commercial design and construction is a plus

Physical Demands:
•	Moderate walking, standing, and/or climbing.
•	Prolonged standing and sitting
•	Must be physically capable of computer, videoconferencing, and phone work

Work Environment:
•	Work outside and inside.
•	Work around machinery with moving parts.
•	Work around moving objects or vehicles.
•	Exposure to dampness and humidity.
•	Exposure to slippery and uneven surfaces. 
•	Exposure to loud noise, dust, and/or fumes. 
•	A moderate noise level is typical for the work environment of this job.

Nothing in this job description restricts Group Delphi’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. This description reflects the assignment of essential function and it does not proscribe or restrict the tasks that may be assigned. This job description may change at any time.

We have been retained by a highly respected high-end residential general contractor to find the best qualified Project Engineer in the San Francisco bay area.  

About The Company
Since 1996, they’ve won 48 accolades and their projects have been notably published 77 times for their high-end residential estate work and north bay wineries.
Widely recognized locally and nationally as a premier builder ($1000/sq ft+) with projects ranging from smaller renovations to expansive estates ($1,000,000 to $50,000,000)
Regionally focused on the San Francisco bay area
About 100 employees
Commercial level project management sophistication
Culture of craftsmanship (in-house cabinetry shop & self-perform carpentry)

What’s In It For You
Working with the best in the high-end construction business. The premier architects, interesting clients, architecturally significant projects, and incredibly experienced construction teams.
An industry-leading benefits package with fully covered healthcare, chiropractic, dental, vision, and life insurance
Paid time off benefit
Paid federal holidays
401k with profit-sharing

Role & Responsibility
The ideal candidate for this position as a Project Engineer will be experienced in construction management with at least 3 to 5 years’ experience as a Project Engineer.  Your intelligence and imagination are key to the success of the project.  Strong communication skills allow for effective communication between you, the architect, subcontractors, superintendent, and foremen.  Subcontractor’s tasks, change orders, submittals, and scheduling are all managed skillfully under your direction.  Proficiency in Prolog, spreadsheet software, and a familiarity with Microsoft Office Suite programs is a valuable asset in the completion of your responsibilities.  

Working in a fast-paced environment is your comfort zone and you welcome the opportunity to use your gifts and talents for the benefit of your team and project.  There is room for growth in this company! You would be given the opportunity to learn and grow into Project Management or Estimating roles.  

Next Step 
If you or someone you know might be interested in this position, we would love to talk! Please feel free to apply with an updated resume and/or project list and we will connect you with James Shellhammer.
All applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, age, color, sex (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, military status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable laws or regulations.

HireArt is helping Toyota Research Institute (TRI) find a Machine Learning Data Engineer to contribute to state-of-the-art machine learning data infrastructure and relevant software specific to data management, data analysis, and data mining at unparalleled scale. In this role, you'll implement robust software and data pipelines for a tremendous amount of data, and analyze large scale data for the practical scenarios of autonomous driving. Last but not least, you will deploy your algorithms and systems to explore the meaningful scenarios in TRI's data sea and beyond.The ideal candidate will possess the basic requirements outlined below as well as 2+ years of experience within the autonomous vehicle industry.As a Machine Learning Data Engineer, you will: Address large scale challenges in the machine learning development cycle, especially around cloud and data engineering.Manipulate high-volume, high-dimensionality, structured data from driving logs for training and testing deep networks.Build a robust data platform that enables ML practitioners to build and maintain their own data pipelines and datasets.Stay up to date on the state-of-the-art in Deep Learning ideas and software, in collaboration with other divisions in the company.Solve challenging problems with cutting edge design and algorithms.Work in a multidisciplinary team and collaborate with other teams across the company.

If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here:
https://www.hireart.com/jobs/0557ed9e/apply


Requirements
Experience as a statistical, machine learning, and/or data engineer and a degree in Computer Science, Math, Physics or related fieldBachelor's Degree with 4+ years of experienceMaster's Degree with 2+ years of experiencePhD with 1+ year of experienceSolid proficiency in PythonStrong software engineering practices with machine learning experience in a production settingProficient in SQL and GitExperience with pipeline orchestration tooling (e.g. Airflow, AWS Step Function, Metaflow, KubeFlow, etc).Experience with AWS, Azure or GCPClear grasp on basic Linear Algebra, Optimization, Statistics, and AlgorithmsNice-to-have ExperienceExperience with data analysis, data, munging and relative machine learning skillsExperience with building end-to-end ML workflows (Data Mining → Data Preparation → Modeling)Strong knowledge of ML dataset management (data + annotations) and exposure to dataset versioning tools such as DVCExperience with ML data annotation pipeline, RESTful APIs, Apache SparkExposure to perception, prediction, and/or planning stacks for robotics/AVsExperience in AV or Automotive industryCommitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), on-going contract position staffed via HireArt and based in Los Altos, CA. This position can be fully remote and is open to U.S.-based candidates who are able to work during PST business hours. Candidates local to Los Altos are preferred.HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas or employ corp-to-corp.TRI provides Equal Employment Opportunity without regard to the applicant's race, color, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, religion, marital status, genetic information, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state or local laws.

If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here:
https://www.hireart.com/jobs/0557ed9e/apply

About Toyota Research Institute
At Toyota Research Institute (TRI), we’re working to build a future where everyone has the freedom to move, engage, and explore with a focus on reducing vehicle collisions, injuries, and fatalities. Join us in our mission to improve the quality of human life through advances in artificial intelligence, automated driving, robotics, and materials science. We’re dedicated to building a world of “mobility for all” where everyone, regardless of age or ability, can live in harmony with technology to enjoy a better life. Through innovations in AI, we’ll... ● Develop vehicles incapable of causing a crash, regardless of the actions of the driver. ● Develop technology for vehicles and robots to help people enjoy new levels of independence, access, and mobility. ● Bring advanced mobility technology to the market faster. ● Discover new materials that will make drive batteries and hydrogen fuel cells smaller, lighter, less expensive and more powerful. Our work is guided by a dedication to safety – in how we research, develop, and validate the performance of vehicle technology to benefit society. As a subsidiary of Toyota, TRI is fueled by a diverse and inclusive community of people who carry invaluable leadership, experience, and ideas from industry-leading companies. Over half of our technical team carries Ph.D. degrees. We’re continually searching for the world’s best talent ‒ people who are ready to define the new world of mobility with us! We strive to build a company that helps our people thrive, achieve work-life balance, and bring their best selves to work. At TRI, you will have the opportunity to enjoy the best of both worlds ‒ a fun start-up environment with brilliant people who enjoy solving tough problems and the financial backing to successfully achieve our goals. If you’re passionate about working with smart people to make cars safer, enable the elderly to age in place, or design alternative fuel sources, TRI is the place for you. ‒ Start your impossible with us. 

If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here:
https://www.hireart.com/jobs/0557ed9e/apply

jobs.title: Career in Tech (Training + Job Placement) - $75k+ Offers
jobs.location: SF bay area /  City Of San Francisco
jobs.description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Flockjay is a 10 week online sales training program that helps you launch a six-figure career in tech.
Everyone wants to break into tech. But unless you're one of the lucky few who went to the right school, have the right connections, and know how to code... it's tough.

But there's another way.

Top tech companies are hungry for sales reps and top performers can quickly make 6 figures.

In our live, online classroom you'll learn modern sales strategy and tactics from expert instructors. Our curriculum is designed by sales executives from leading tech companies to get you job ready in just 10 weeks. More than just theory, you'll gain experience with the real tools and software that sales reps use and even practice real selling.

Never heard of us? That's OK.

We're backed by investors like Serena Williams, Will Smith, and Gabrille Union. Plus we're one of the highest rated tech sales training programs out there. Just check out our reviews on Glassdoor and CourseReport.

Flockjay isn't just a training program, we also work to get you hired. We'll work together to revamp your resume, prepare you with mock interviews, and help negotiate the best offer. Skip the resume black hole and get direct intro's to our hiring partners who are looking for Flockjay grads with job ready skills.

Our partners have committed to making careers in tech more accessible. They love hiring Flockjay grads because having a more diverse team means having a more productive team. Our students have launched successful careers at places like Zoom, Salesforce, and Slack.

Once you join Flockjay you're part of our flock for life. You'll have lifetime access to our internal community of sales professionals, industry execs, and fellow alumni. We continue to support your career growth with networking events, additional learning opportunities, and mentorship programs.

10 weeks of Expert Training and Coaching
Learn in our online video classroom with live instructors
Classes run Mon-Thurs 5pm-8pm PST
Get warm intro's to our hiring partners
Join our community of industry execs and top sales reps
Access job and career support even after you graduate

Interested? Apply today at Flockjay.com

FAQs
Who is this for?
Flockjay is perfect for anyone looking to break into tech sales, no matter their background, prior experience or education level. We have successful students from all walks of life with backgrounds in customer service, hospitality, retail, and more. We aim to promote diversity and inclusion in our students, hiring partners, and our own staff.

What types of jobs can I land after graduating?
Flockjay graduates are well positioned for entry level sales roles such as SDR (Sales Development Rep) and BDR (Business Development Rep) at large tech companies and smaller startups. Other potential roles include Account Executive, Account Development Representative, Sales Engineer, Market Development Representative, Outbound Representative.

How much money can I make in tech sales after Flockjay?
Our graduates receive offers ranging from $60k to $90k in total compensation. The average package is over $75k. Additionally, Flockjay graduates are among the top performers at their respective companies and are promoted faster than their peers.
You can read about the ROI of joining Flockjay here.


This sounds too good to be true. Is this real?
Yes, Flockjay is real and there's no catch! See what our graduates say about us on Glassdoor.com and CourseReport.

Is this a full time or part time commitment?
Flockjay is a part time, remote learning program that spans 10 weeks. Classes meet 100% online 4 nights a week, Monday through Thursday from 5PM to 8PM Pacific time. There are also optional office hours and 1 on 1 help sessions.

How much does this cost?
Tuition is $7,650. With our Deferred Tuition option you can start for $0 upfront. After you graduate and are making $40k+, you pay $425/month for 18 months.
With our upfront tuition option, you pay $6,000 (20% discount). Due to state regulations, we are unable to offer this discount to residents of California.
You can read more about our tuition options here.


Learn more at Flockjay.com
